title: Data Enterprise Architect
description:
**NOTE - Candidate must be Local from Florida and must be US Citizen and GC** 

**Requirements:**

*For Enterprise Architect:*

* IT work experience in multiple IT areas (7+ years);
* Enterprise-wide architecture experience in one or more specialty areas (2-3 years);
* Experience in providing overall direction, guidance and definition of an enterprise’s architecture to effectively support the corporate business strategy;
* Experience in analyzing data requirements, application and processing architectures, data dictionaries, and database schema(s), and then designing, developing, amending, optimizing, and certifying database schema design to meet system(s) requirements;
* Experience in researching, analyzing, designing, proposing, and delivering solutions that are appropriate for the business and technology strategies;
* Experience developing a conception of solutions, building consensus, and the execution of such solutions;

*For Data Architect:*

* Experience with large and complex database management systems (7+ years);
* Experience making recommendations for enterprise-wide data design, balancing optimization of data access with batch loading and resource utilization factors (i.e. experience in Relational databases such as SQL, Db2, and Oracle);
* Experience in most aspects of designing and constructing data architectures, operational data stores, and data marts;
* Experience in business analysis and design, Database Management Systems optimization, recovery strategy and load strategy design and implementation.

**Responsibilities** include but are not limited to the following:

* Make recommendations for enterprise-wide data design, balancing optimization of data

access with batch loading and resource utilization factors.

* Provide knowledge and guidance related to aspects of designing and constructing data

architectures, operational data stores, and data marts.

* Provide business analysis and design, Database Management Systems optimization,

recovery strategy and load strategy design and implementation

* Provides overall direction, guidance, and definition of the Department’s architecture to

effectively support the corporate business strategy.

* Analyze data requirements, application and processing architectures, data dictionaries, and

database schema(s), and then designs, develops, amends, optimizes, and certifies database  
schema design to meet system(s) requirements.

* Responsibilities include researching, analyzing, designing, proposing, and delivering

solutions that are appropriate for the business and technology strategies.

* Responsible for conception of solutions, building consensus, and the execution of such

solutions.

Job Type: Contract

Salary: $40.00 - $50.00 per hour

Experience:

* Azure: 1 year (Preferred)
* AWS: 1 year (Preferred)
* APIs: 1 year (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

title: Solutions Architect - GIS Enterprise - Electric Utilities
description:
**Solutions Architect - GIS Enterprise - Electric Utilities** 

**What You’ll Do:** 

* Development of technical vision and direction, roadmap, and alignment with business targets. Oversee execution of vision into tangible outcomes within R&D, system architecture, products, and services. Delegation of tasks and projects to sub teams.
* Leverage seasoned experience within GIS, software development/deployment, and IT of self and others to achieve outcomes in critical infrastructure, workflows and products. Nurturing and enforcing best practices.
* Functional requirements gathering, quality control design, diagrams, and mockups as part of technical documentation, and maintaining, implementing, and monitoring a system of quality control.
* Defining architecture specifications, skillsets, development environment, development approach as solution architect or with solution architect, and participation in identifying technical requirements in proposal writing, estimates, identifying areas of concern or risk.
* Designing and supporting quality control methods within GIS Data Infrastructure and coding frameworks, while maintaining an expert level of technical expertise in self and team by identifying individual training needs and scheduling appropriate training programs.

**Required Qualifications:** 

* Bachelor’s degree in GIS, IT, or Computer Science from an accredited university or equivalent technical degree
* 15+ years of work experience in (10 years in GIS/ESRI products, 5 years in Consultation of hardware and software deployment and support, 2 years in IT or tech support, 2 years in database management
* One or more ESRI Technical Certifications – Enterprise System Design Professional, Enterprise Administration Professional, Enterprise Geodata Management Professional
* Certification in GIS (GISP), Cloud deployment, or related technology is a plus.
* Programming skills in Python, SQL, JavaScript, C# (backend or frontend)

**Not quite right for you? For a full listing of all our openings, please visit us at:** https://entrustsol.com/careers/

ENTRUST Solutions Group does not accept unsolicited headhunter or agency resumes and will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with ENTRUST Solutions Group.***

title: Business Architect
description:
**Business Architect**

**remote work**

**5 months contract**

**What you’ll be doing:**

* Working with the project team to develop and implement a business architecture strategy based on situational awareness of various business scenarios and motivations.
* Recommending and applying a structured business architecture approach and methodology for the capture and creation of key views of the enterprise.
* Managing the tactical and strategic enterprise goals ensuring traceability.
* Maintaining a broad, enterprise-wide view of the business and varying degrees of appreciation for strategy, processes and capabilities, enabling technologies, data, and governance.
* Applying strategic thinking in recommending process improvement and reengineering methodologies.

**What you’ll need:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration or related field.
* Minimum of six (6) years of relevant experience.
* Demonstrated ability to recognize structural issues and recommend improvements within an organization, functional interdependencies, and cross-silo redundancies.
* Demonstrated expert ability in using model-based representations and other high level modeling techniques, oral and written communications, and situational analysis and decision making abilities.
* Experience in maturing and maintaining business architecture programs within an organization.
* Expertise in consolidating disparate and dispersed business information into an integrated and structured framework.
* Mastery of integrating business architecture with other enterprise architecture domains (e.g., data architecture, application architecture, etc.).
* Skilled in areas of business process management, business relationship management, risk management, and security.
* Stakeholder engagement, meeting facilitation, and expert communications (written, verbal, and presentation).
* Demonstrate proficiency in using Microsoft applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, SharePoint, Teams, and Visio).
* US Citizenship (required by federal government).

**Preferred Skills/Experience:**

* Master’s degree in Business Administration.
* Working understanding of Federal IT services models and frameworks to support the project team to meet client requirements.
* Demonstrated ability to work with senior management.
* Exceptional verbal and writing communication skills, including editing and proofreading.
* Demonstrated customer service orientation and outstanding level of professionalism in providing client support.
* Solid understanding of on-Prem and off-Prem (Cloud) based environments.

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Pay: $90,000.00 - $110,000.00 per year

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote

title: Enterprise Architect
description:
**Secure our Nation, Ignite your Future**


Become an integral part of a diverse team while working at an Industry Leading Organization, where our employees come first. At ManTech International Corporation, you’ll help protect our national security while working on innovative projects that offer opportunities for advancement.

  

Currently, ManTech is seeking a motivated, career and customer-oriented Enterprise Architect to join our team. This opportunity is remote.

 **Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:**

* Lead the technical engagements to assess client business and technical objectives, determine deliverables, evaluate risk and execute projects effectively.
* Architects and designs enterprise-class security systems for a production environment
* Align standards, frameworks and security with overall business and technology strategy
* Identify and communicate current and emerging security threats
* Conduct Design Workshops with multiple stakeholders
* Design security architecture elements to mitigate threats as they emerge
* Create solutions that balance business requirements with information and cyber security requirements
* Identify security design gaps in existing and proposed architectures and recommend changes or enhancements
* Work with Service Design management to develop strategic plans for architecture, engineering, integration, and dashboard
* Ensure ManTech policies and procedures are followed via audits and other inspection mechanisms.
* Provide reporting and feedback to senior management as required
* Support the development and delivery of RFS proposals and/or Rough Orders Magnitude (ROMs) for initiatives as required
* Assist in rectifying issues and improving service in faltering/failing projects
 **Basic Requirements:**

* 10 years of enterprise architecting & engineering experience
* Experience implementing multiple types of technical solutions (preferably security tools) in complex and heterogeneous environments. Must be able to clearly articulate your experience in:

Architecting, designing, engineering, integrating, configuring, and deploying COTS solutions into enterprises.


Experience with Disaster Recovery and Business Continuity Planning


Experience leading enterprise solution integration planning activities


Experience with enterprise security solutions

* 8 years of experience deploying technical solutions into enterprises
* 8 years of IT security operational experience, including assessment of information assurance and interoperability.
* 6 years of experience working with Security Authorization requirements, developing and enhancing the security risk posture, and analysis and reporting of IT security metrics.
* 4 years of experience in security policy and emerging cybersecurity technologies.
* Experience collaborating with Agencies to mature operational processes, reduce redundancies, and develop innovative solutions
* Experience understanding organizational needs, proposing solutions, and managing project execution efforts designed to deliver overall program benefits for Government Agencies
* Experience collaborating with US Government Agencies, state or local governments, or commercial entities to develop IT service program maturity in accordance with Federal IT mandates and best practices
* Strong experience in ensuring customer satisfaction, problem resolution, and risk management on several medium to large projects
* Experience in NIST RMF or CDM Framework
* Experience in conducting assessments of an Enterprise by reviewing technical documentations, conducting interviews and workshops to identify gaps and developing a tailored solution is highly desired
* Demonstrated experience in security solution design using existing and emerging technologies to achieve enterprise solutions.
* General scripting experience
* Must hold a Security Certification
* Bachelor’s degree in technical field
 **Security requirements:**

* US citizenship with the ability to obtain up to a secret level clearance

**Preferred Requirements**:

* A ISC2 CISSP, CCIE, CCSP, Security+, CCNP Security, CCNA Security, CISA, VCP, GSE, SCNA, GCIH, and/or GLSC
**Physical Requirements:**

* Must be able to remain in a stationary position 50%
* Constantly operates a computer and other office productivity machinery, such as a calculator, copy machine and computer printer.
* The person in this position frequently communicates with co-workers, management and customers, which may involve delivering presentations. Must be able to exchange accurate information in these situations
  


The projected compensation range for this position is $141,100-$234,400. There are differentiating factors that can impact a final salary/hourly rate, including, but not limited to, Contract Wage Determination, relevant work experience, skills and competencies that align to the specified role, geographic location (For Remote Opportunities), education and certifications as well as Federal Government Contract Labor categories. In addition, ManTech invests in it’s employees beyond just compensation. ManTech’s benefits offerings include, dependent upon position, Health Insurance, Life Insurance, Paid Time Off, Holiday Pay, Short Term and Long Term Disability, Retirement and Savings, Learning and Development opportunities, wellness programs as well as other optional benefit elections.
For all positions requiring access to technology/software source code that is subject to export control laws, employment with the company is contingent on either verifying U.S.-person status or obtaining any necessary license. The applicant will be required to answer certain questions for export control purposes, and that information will be reviewed by compliance personnel to ensure compliance with federal law. ManTech may choose not to apply for a license for such individuals whose access to export-controlled technology or software source code may require authorization and may decline to proceed with an applicant on that basis alone.


ManTech International Corporation, as well as its subsidiaries proactively fulfills its role as an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, national origin, marital status, physical or mental disability, status as a Disabled Veteran, Recently Separated Veteran, Active Duty Wartime or Campaign Badge Veteran, Armed Forces Services Medal, or any other characteristic protected by law.


If you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a position with ManTech through its online applicant system, please contact ManTech's Corporate EEO Department at (703) 218-6000. ManTech is an affirmative action/equal opportunity employer - minorities, females, disabled and protected veterans are urged to apply. ManTech's utilization of any external recruitment or job placement agency is predicated upon its full compliance with our equal opportunity/affirmative action policies. ManTech does not accept resumes from unsolicited recruiting firms. We pay no fees for unsolicited services.


If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you have the right to request an accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access http://www.mantech.com/careers/Pages/careers.aspx as a result of your disability. To request an accommodation please click careers@mantech.com and provide your name and contact information.

title: Software Architect
description:
**Secure our Nation, Ignite your Future**


Become an integral part of a diverse team while working at an Industry Leading Organization, where our employees come first. At ManTech International, you’ll help protect our national security while working on innovative projects that offer opportunities for advancement. ManTech is looking for an experienced Software Architect to make intuitive high-level decisions for Modeling and Simulation (M&S) software development. Candidate will work “big picture” in creating architectural approaches for software design and implementation to guide the development team. Software Architect applicants must have a strong technical background and excellent IT skills. Have extensive experience in designing and ability to develop a unified vision for software characteristics and functions to be eligible for this remote opportunity.

**Basic Overview:**


The Software Architect will perform the following tasks:

* Define and communicate the technical/architectural vision for NIMS.
* Participate in planning, definition, and high-level design of the solution and exploration of solution alternatives.
* Enable the Continuous Delivery Pipeline through appropriate design guidelines and investment.
* advocacy
* Actively participate in the Continuous Exploration process as part of the Continuous Delivery Pipeline, especially with enabler Epics
* Define subsystems and their interfaces, allocate responsibilities to subsystems, understand solution deployment, and communicate requirements for interactions with solution context Work with customers, stakeholders, and suppliers to establish high-level solution intent, and the solution intent information models and documentation requirements.
* Establish critical NFRs for the solution and participate in the definition of others Operate within an economic framework when analyzing the impact of design decisions.
* Work with portfolio stakeholders, notably the Enterprise Architect, to develop, analyze, split, and realize the implementation of enabler epics.
* Participate in Program Increment (PI) Planning and Pre- and Post-PI Planning, System and Solution Demos, and Inspect and Adapt(I&A) events.
* Define, explore, and support the implementation of enablers to evolve solution intent, working directly with Agile teams to implement them.
* Plan and develop the Architectural Runway in support of new business Features and Capabilities Work with Product and Solution Management to determine the capacity allocation for enablement work.
* Support technology/engineering aspects of program and solution Kanbans, provide oversight and foster Built-In Quality and Team and Technical Agility


As the NIMS software architect

* Define the microservices architecture and communication pathways to accomplish NIMS requirements
* Understand and work with cloud technologies.

**Requirements Include:**

* Minimum Secret security clearance required at start.
* BS Degree in Software Engineering or related degree and 5 years of experience performing Software Architecture duties.
* IAT II Level II certification, i.e., COMPTia Security+
* Familiarity with API gateways (hands-on preferred)
* Microservice architecture design
* REST API - Python Fast API (preferred)
* UML design experience
* Ability to create DoDAF artifacts.


The projected compensation range for this position is $107,600-$180,100. There are differentiating factors that can impact a final salary/hourly rate, including, but not limited to, Contract Wage Determination, relevant work experience, skills and competencies that align to the specified role, geographic location (For Remote Opportunities), education and certifications as well as Federal Government Contract Labor categories. ManTech’s benefits offerings include, dependent upon position, Health Insurance, Life Insurance, Paid Time Off, Holiday Pay, Short Term and Long Term Disability, Retirement and Savings, Learning and Development opportunities, wellness programs as well as other optional benefit elections.

The applicant will be required to answer certain questions for export control purposes, and that information will be reviewed by compliance personnel to ensure compliance with federal law. ManTech may choose not to apply for a license for such individuals whose access to export-controlled technology or software source code may require authorization and may decline to proceed with an applicant on that basis alone.


ManTech International Corporation, as well as its subsidiaries proactively fulfills its role as an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, national origin, marital status, physical or mental disability, status as a Disabled Veteran, Recently Separated Veteran, Active Duty Wartime or Campaign Badge Veteran, Armed Forces Services Medal, or any other characteristic protected by law.


If you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a position with ManTech through its online applicant system, please contact ManTech's Corporate EEO Department at (703) 218-6000. ManTech is an affirmative action/equal opportunity employer - minorities, females, disabled and protected veterans are urged to apply. title: Specialist Information Systems Architect
description:
**HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION?**


You’ve worked hard to become the professional you are today and are now ready to take the next step in your career. How will you put your skills, experience and passion to work toward your goals? At Amgen, our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies, reaching over 10 million patients worldwide. Come do your best work alongside other innovative, driven professionals in this meaningful role.

**Specialist IS Architect**

**Live**
--------

**What you will do**


Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. In this vital role you will be an integral member of the DTI team working on a newly formed Agile Product Team that will own Amgen's Structured Content Authoring and Generative AI solutions supporting the common technical document submission process and their integration with upstream and downstream data sources and systems. The position is located in our offices in Thousand Oaks, CA, or Tampa, FL, or we can also consider remote applicants in a United States. Come join our team and be a part of something new that we can be proud of!

**Role & Responsibilities:**
----------------------------

* Provides design guidance that follows the enterprise architecture vision and adheres to applicable application technology guidelines; mitigates the impact of technical design on security, performance and data privacy
* Plans and develops architectural designs and application solutions
* Resolves technical issues and seeks application rationalization
* Identify and prototype tools and technology, in both an advisory, and in some cases, hands-on capacity
* Leads other engineers by example
* Integrates systems with commercial off-the-shelf applications and custom developed applications
* Migrates existing applications and develops new applications in major cloud platforms
* Communicates effectively with senior leadership
* Interprets and translates goals into technical specifications and drives technological change
* Demonstrates business and domain acumen to interpret and translate architecture plans into business plans
* Collaborates with other architects and developers to provide technical design guidance that aligns with strategy and technical standards
* Evaluates and makes strategic design decisions that address specific technological needs
* Develops and maintains application roadmaps
* Researches and evaluates emerging technologies and novel approaches to make recommendations that enhance business processes and/or create competitive advantages
* Collaborates with multidisciplinary teams to resolve complex technical issues; uses analytical thinking skills to identify, debug and resolve technical issues
* Uses business knowledge and interpersonal skills to build, maintain and influence relationships with senior leaders and suppliers

**Win**
-------

**What we expect of you**


We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The professional we seek will have these qualifications.

**Basic Qualifications:**
-------------------------

**Doctorate degree**
--------------------


OR


Master’s degree and 3 years of Information Systems experience


OR


Bachelor’s degree and 5 years of Information Systems experience


OR


Associate degree and 10 years of Information Systems

**Or**
------


High school diploma/GED and 12 years of Information Systems experience

**Preferred Qualifications:**
-----------------------------

* Familiar with Amgen City Planning platforms like Amazon Web Services, Salesforce, MuleSoft, Databricks, etc.
* Understands established software development lifecycles and methodologies including Agile, iterative and waterfall, using blended resources
* Learns rapidly and continuously takes advantage of new technologies, concepts and business models
* Stays current with emerging technology trends
* Experience with architectural design and application delivery
* Acquainted with Lean IT principles and data-driven approaches
* Familiar with architectural domains including cloud application architecture and container-based deployment
* Excellent analytical and problem solving, communication and presentation skills
* Good understanding of business complexity and project inter-dependencies
* Intellectual curiosity and the ability to question thought partners across disciplines
* Outstanding communication and the ability to communicate appropriately at all levels of the organization; this includes written and verbal communications as well as visualizations
* Good understanding of basic system engineering, information risk and security guidelines and architecture standards
* Be a great teammate able to work effectively at all levels of an organization with the ability to influence others to move toward consensus

**Thrive**
----------

**What you can expect of us**


As we work to develop treatments that take care of others, we also work to care for our teammates’ professional and personal growth and well-being.


Amgen offers a Total Rewards Plan comprising health and welfare plans for staff and eligible dependents, financial plans with opportunities to save towards retirement or other goals, work/life balance, and career development opportunities including:

* Comprehensive employee benefits package, including a Retirement and Savings Plan with generous company contributions, group medical, dental and vision coverage, life and disability insurance, and flexible spending accounts.
* A discretionary annual bonus program, or for field sales representatives, a sales-based incentive plan
* Stock-based long-term incentives
* Award-winning time-off plans and bi-annual company-wide shutdowns
* Flexible work models, including remote work arrangements, where possible

**Apply now for a career that defies imagination**
--------------------------------------------------


Objects in your future are closer than they appear. Join us.

**careers.amgen.com**
---------------------


Amgen is an Equal Opportunity employer and will consider you without regard to your race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.


We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

title: Enterprise Platform Solutions Architect
description:
cFocus Software seeks an Enterprise Platform Solutions Architect to join our program supporting the US Department of Health and Human Services (HHS), Office of the Inspector General. This is a fully remote position. This position requires an active Public Trust clearance and must meet 8570 requirements.  

  

**Qualifications:*** 10+ years of related platform-based experience in technology solution delivery or the equivalent.
* Degree in Computer Science or related field and masters preferred.
* ServiceNow Platform and/or Systems Integration experience preferred.
* Active Public Trust Clearance
* 8570 Compliant (Security+ CE)
* Expert knowledge of enterprise architecture concepts, agile solution delivery, and expert proficiency in Cloud solutions and PaaS platforms to include AWS, ServiceNow, etc.
* Active AWS Certified Solutions Architect certification.
* Active ServiceNow Certified Application Developer (CAD)

  

**Duties:*** Oversees technical delivery for the entire Program. Oversees application architecture and ensures alignment with all solutions delivered under this Program.
* Serving as the Contractor’s technical point of contact, and this individual is responsible for the technical oversight of platform instances.
* Oversees the technical portion of the program across schedule, resources, risk, quality, etc., and monitoring the on-going, execution of these areas.
* Leads the architectural design and completeness of the entire platform.
* Reviews and recommends other tools and solutions for consideration to be added to the Platform.
* Coordinates and collaborates on technical requirements with all staff.
* Key POC for platform-based issues, questions, and solutions for IT leadership, staff, and other contractor staff.
* Provide configuration, customization, and modernization services to assist the OIG in modernizing identified systems and applications using the OIG ServiceNow platform architecture.
* Provide architecture, design, and modernization services using the OIG ServiceNow architecture as identified and directed by the COR.
* Coordinate project support with the COR and/or any OIG designated stakeholders.
* Maintain existing modules HHS-OIG has implemented in ServiceNow to include Information Technology Service Management (ITSM), Strategic Portfolio Management (SPM), Security Operations Professional, Asset Management.
* Provide resources/support for the implementation of any new modules, as directed by the COR and determined by OCIO leadership.
* Collect and gather business requirements for custom application implementation, including any enhancements of existing applications.
* Architect andmanage the data contained within the applications in accordance with industry best practices, keeping in mind enterprise standards and needs.
* Ensure applications, features, services on the ServiceNow platform take user needs into account incorporating usability best practices and standards.
* Maintain appropriate project documentation, as directed by the COR.
* Participate in requirement analysis planning in support of the migration and integration of current legacy systems.
* Examine systems for the purpose of achieving long term, full-scale integration required for the Government.
* Develop options for process improvement and develop tools as directed to support analyses.
* Develop data models from existing application software and across functional domains for the purpose of designing standard/common/ migration systems.
* Evaluate process models within a functional area to facilitate data model development and data integration.
* Participate in the development of data migration strategies to identify the plans and processes for the transition of current legacy data.
* Review and analyze the implementation and migration of new technologies and develop recommendations for supporting the integration into an integrated application architecture.




VP7xAE0xVo

title: Director, Enterprise Architecture
description:
**About AGC Biologics**  

AGC Biologics is a leading global biopharmaceutical Contract Development and Manufacturing Organization (CDMO) with a strong commitment to delivering the highest standard of service as we work side-by-side with our clients and partners, every step of the way. We provide world-class development and manufacture of mammalian and microbial-based therapeutic proteins, plasmid DNA (pDNA), messenger RNA (mRNA), viral vectors, and genetically engineered cells. Our global network spans the U.S., Europe, and Asia, with cGMP-compliant facilities in Seattle, Washington; Boulder and Longmont, Colorado; Copenhagen, Denmark; Heidelberg, Germany; Milan, Italy; and Chiba, Japan. We currently employ more than 2,500 employees worldwide. Our commitment to continuous innovation fosters the technical creativity to solve our clients' most complex challenges, including specialization in fast-track projects and rare diseases. AGC Biologics is the partner of choice. To learn more, visit www.agcbio.com.

  


**JOB SUMMARY**



We are seeking a highly skilled and dedicated Director, Enterprise Architecture to join our team. As Director, Enterprise Architecture, you will play a critical role in the success of our Information Technology strategy, operational platform, and of strategic initiatives that involve our system architecture.

  


**ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES**


* Proactively and holistically champions technical/operational transformation and optimization initiatives.
* Leads the development of a value proposition and execution of a communication and education plan for the enterprise architecture practice.
* Develops and deploys a prioritized roadmap for the overall enterprise architecture approach for the organization, and communicates it effectively across key stakeholder groups.
* Effectively promotes the business value of Enterprise Architecture as an enabler of strategy formulation, and as support for technology innovation.
* Leads the creation of the Enterprise Architecture ('EA') sub-function, ensuring consistent progress in the development of the organization, its ways of working, standard processes, and success measures.
* Leads the development of the EA service portfolio, ensuring it is aligned to the needs of the organization and to the needs of EA's key stakeholders.
* Translates and executes business strategy to achieve the organization's targeted business outcomes by leading the development of an implementation roadmap for the enterprise architecture.
* Constructs technology-enabled business and operating models and provides viable options and visibility into execution issues.
* Facilitates business and IT alignment through a collaborative, supportive and consultative manner, driving the organization's digital business strategies and balancing innovation and growth.
* Collaborates with delivery teams to ensure consistency with the enterprise architecture and to leverage shared technologies, tools and processes that impact speed to value and time to market.
* Collaborates with infrastructure teams to ensure consistency with the enterprise architecture, as well as to identify when it is necessary to modify the enterprise architecture.
* Recruits and develops the critical skills, competencies and career paths for the EA team members; in particular, building the business and behavioral competencies needed to support the success of the group
* Provides ongoing coaching and mentoring to members of the EA team.
* Helps the enterprise find the right balance between enterprise risk and agility. Communicates key EA positions to business and IT leaders on an ongoing basis to get, and maintain, buy-in and alignment.

  


**LEADERSHIP & KEY SKILLS**


* Strong leadership skills with exceptional soft and interpersonal skills, including teamwork, facilitation, collaboration and negotiation.
* Deep understanding of existing, new and emerging technologies, and processing environments.
* In-depth knowledge of business ecosystems, SaaS, infrastructure as a service (IaaS), platform as a service (PaaS), service-oriented architecture (SOA), APIs, open data, microservices, event-driven IT and predictive analytics.
* In-depth knowledge of information management practices, system development life cycle management, IT services management, agile and lean methodologies, infrastructure and operations, and EA and ITIL frameworks.
* Understanding of the different types of agile principles, methodologies and frameworks, especially those designed to be scaled at the enterprise level.

  


**QUALIFICATIONS**

**Required:**


* Bachelor's degree in business, computer science, computer engineering, electrical engineering or a related field of study, or equivalent experience required.
* 8+ years of business experience in strategic and operations planning and/or business analysis; and/or
* 8+ years of experience in at least three disciplines, such as business, information, solution or technical architecture or application development in a multitier environment.

  


**Preferred:**


* Master's degree in business, computer science, computer engineering, electrical engineering, or related field.

  


**COMPENSATION RANGE: $164,400 – $226,050**



Fluctuations in the job market may necessitate adjustments to pay ranges. Final pay determinations will depend on various factors, including, but not limited to experience levels, knowledge, skills, and abilities.



Benefits available to Team Members include subsidized insurance for the Team Member and designated dependents (medical, vision, dental, life and disability), eligibility to participate in the AGC Biologics 401(k) plan (including a generous matching contribution from the company and immediate vesting), vacation, sick time, and parental leave.



Team Members are also eligible to receive a discretionary annual bonus commensurate to the level of the role. The payout is based on both the company's performance and the Team Member's performance.

  


*AGC Biologics offers a highly competitive compensation package and a friendly, collaborative culture that values personal initiative and professional achievement. AGC Biologics is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.*

title: Cloud Solution Architect - Platform Operations Lead
description:
**Job Description**
-------------------

***This role is based remotely but if you live within a 50-mile radius of Warren, MI, you are expected to report to that location three times a week, at minimum***

**The Role:**

General Motors is a forward-thinking organization dedicated to harnessing the power of data to drive business growth and innovation. We are looking for an accomplished Lead Architect with a strong background in creating data assets, developing data products, and a robust release management practice that allows GM to implement machine learning models. As a pivotal member of our technology leadership team, you will play a key role in shaping our data architecture strategy and ensuring the successful delivery of insights that contribute to the organization's financial success.


This role focuses on the day to day Operations of the GM "Insight Factory" - including End to End health of the data ecosystem.


**What You'll Do:**  



**Data Architecture and Strategy:**

* Lead the development and execution of the overall data architecture strategy. (Azure based with Databricks at this time)
* Design and implement robust data assets, ensuring scalability, reliability, and performance.
* Add functionality/expand the limits of functionality of GitHub Enterprise, GitHub Actions, Git Flow (including CoPilot)
* Build additional functionality into the existing CICD to produce reliable release artifacts that allow us to control the quality of code in our environment.
* Work closely with the Operations Lead to implement APM that allows for the creation and monitoring of “End to End” timing charts – every step and no step missed.
Work with Infra Leads to implement deployment isolation and release best practices to ensure smooth, frequent releases with appropriate rollback.  
* 

  

**Data Product and ML Model and Application Development:**

* Oversee the creation of data products that leverage the organization's data assets.
* Lead the development and deployment of machine learning models that enhance decision-making processes
* Leverage our existing stack – including ML Flow - to implement ML Ops and create a model registry.
Develop approach to support Dev,Test,PreProd and Prod environment release process.  
* 

  

**Integration with Dashboards and Applications:**

* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate data assets, data products, and ML models into dashboards and applications.
Ensure seamless interaction between data components and front-end applications.  
* 

  

**Insight Generation and Monetization:**

* Play a pivotal role in generating actionable insights from data products and ML models.
Work closely with business stakeholders to identify opportunities for monetizing data assets and insights.  
* 

  

**Hands-on Leadership:**

* Be hands-on with the creation and implementation of data assets, data products, and ML models.
Mentor and guide a team of skilled professionals in adopting best practices and achieving project goals.  
* 

  

**Continuous Innovation:**

* Stay abreast of emerging trends and technologies in data architecture, machine learning, and analytics.
* Drive continuous innovation in the development of data assets and ML models.

**Your Skills & Abilities (Required Qualifications):**

* Proven experience as a Lead Architect with a focus on creating data assets, developing data products, and implementing ML models.
* 1.5 years of operating experience with Cloud Based Production AI/ML/Data Systems.
* Proven ability to create an end to end Threat Analysis with a Threat Modeling tool.
* Experience in creating key rotation automation.
* Experience running the security perimeter of Azure app services or equivalent.
* Ability to create complete Architecture Diagrams in Lucid or Visio - for review by Enterprise Architecture Review Board.
* Experience creating end to end Data Flow Diagrams.
* Experience with running various caching approaches to achieve sub 200MS response times.
* Direct experience instrumenting "every hop" in a data ecosystem via Healthcheck heartbeat monitors that are API ready and can be rolled up into a single pane of glass health dashboard.
* Requirements/Tools: Azure, Databricks, CICD, APM, Hands on keyboard capability - Python preferred
* Strong understanding of data architecture principles, including data modeling, ETL processes, and data warehousing.
* Experience with machine learning frameworks and tools, with a track record of successful model development and deployment.
* Proficiency in integrating data assets with dashboards and applications to deliver actionable insights.
* Excellent leadership and communication skills, with the ability to collaborate with technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Demonstrated success in driving projects that contribute to organizational revenue.
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science , Information Technology, or a related field; Advanced degree or relevant certifications in data architecture, machine learning, or related areas is highly desirable.

**Additional Job Description**
------------------------------

**GM DOES NOT PROVIDE IMMIGRATION-RELATED SPONSORSHIP FOR THIS ROLE. DO NOT APPLY FOR THIS ROLE IF YOU WILL NEED GM IMMIGRATION SPONSORSHIP (e.g., H-1B, TN, STEM OPT, etc.) NOW OR IN THE FUTURE.**

**About GM**
------------

Our vision is a world with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion and we embrace the responsibility to lead the change that will make our world better, safer and more equitable for all.


**Why Join Us**
---------------

We aspire to be the most inclusive company in the world. We believe we all must make a choice every day – individually and collectively – to drive meaningful change through our words, our deeds and our culture. Our Work Appropriately philosophy supports our foundation of inclusion and provides employees the flexibility to work where they can have the greatest impact on achieving our goals, dependent on role needs. Every day, we want every employee, no matter their background, ethnicity, preferences, or location, to feel they belong to one General Motors team.


**Benefits Overview**
---------------------

The goal of the General Motors total rewards program is to support the health and well-being of you and your family. Our comprehensive compensation plan incudes, the following benefits, in addition to many others:
  

* Paid time off including vacation days, holidays, and parental leave for mothers, fathers and adoptive parents;
* Healthcare (including a triple tax advantaged health savings account and wellness incentive), dental, vision and life insurance plans to cover you and your family;
* Company and matching contributions to 401K savings plan to help you save for retirement;
* Global recognition program for peers and leaders to recognize and be recognized for results and behaviors that reflect our company values;
* Tuition assistance and student loan refinancing;
* Discount on GM vehicles for you, your family and friends.
**Diversity Information**
-------------------------

General Motors is committed to being a workplace that is not only free of discrimination, but one that genuinely fosters inclusion and belonging. We strongly believe that workforce diversity creates an environment in which our employees can thrive and develop better products for our customers. We understand and embrace the variety through which people gain experiences whether through professional, personal, educational, or volunteer opportunities. GM is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.  



  

We encourage interested candidates to review the key responsibilities and qualifications and apply for any positions that match your skills and capabilities.


**Equal Employment Opportunity Statements**
-------------------------------------------

GM is an equal opportunity employer and complies with all applicable federal, state, and local fair employment practices laws. GM is committed to providing a work environment free from unlawful discrimination and advancing equal employment opportunities for all qualified individuals. As part of this commitment, all practices and decisions relating to terms and conditions of employment, including, but not limited to, recruiting, hiring, training, promotion, discipline, compensation, benefits, and termination of employment are made without regard to an indivi d ual's protected characteristics. For purposes of this policy, “protected characteristics" include an individual's actual or perceived race, color, creed, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, age, sex or gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, lactation and related medical conditions), gender identity or gender expression, sexual orientation, weight, height, marital status, military service and veteran status, physical or mental disability, protected medical condition as defined by applicable state or local law, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local laws and ordinances. If you need a reasonable accommodation to assist with your job search or application for employment, email us at Careers.Accommodations@GM.com or call us at 800-865-7580. In your email, please include a description of the specific accommodation you are requesting as well as the job title and requisition number of the position for which you are applying.

title: Solution Architect
description:
USRC's greatest strength in being a leader in the dialysis industry is our ability to recognize and celebrate the differences in our diverse workforce. We strongly believe in recruiting top talent and creating a diverse and inclusive work climate and culture at all levels of our organization.



SUMMARY



The **solution architect** proactively and holistically leads and supports infrastructure and application architecture activities that guide the development and management of a portfolio of solutions. Solutions include projects, products, systems (including applications, technologies, processes, and information), shared infrastructure services and shared application services and components to enable and drive targeted business outcomes.



The Solution Architect will have a deep understanding of business goals, objectives and business outcomes, business capabilities, value-streams, and business processes. The solution architect provides the necessary leadership and performs analysis/design tasks to support the development of technology solutions. This person will have an overall responsibility to ensure that solutions meet business needs and align with architectural governance and standards. He or she creates deliverables for managing the organization's portfolio of target-state, interim and current-state solutions.



Essential Duties and Responsibilities



Translating Business Strategy into Architecture


* Understands business drivers and business capabilities (future and current state) and determines corresponding enterprise system designs and change requirements to drive the organization's targeted business outcomes.
* Understands emerging technology trends and disruptions and the practical application of existing, new, and emerging technologies to enable new and evolving business and operating models.
* Translates business and technical requirements into a technical architectural blueprint inclusive of application, data, infrastructure and process considerations and documents all solution architecture design and analysis work.
* Owns and drives deliverables such as standard definitions, capability models, reference architecture models and design patterns to help align and accelerate projects and ongoing technology investment.
* Acts as a consultant to internal teams on a broad range of technologies, platforms, and vendor offerings to drive targeted business outcomes.


Leading Solution Design and Analysis


* Leads evaluation, design, and analysis for the implementation of solutions across a group of specific business applications or technologies based on enterprise business strategy, business capabilities, value-streams, business requirements and enterprise standards.
* Creates architectural designs to guide and contextualize solution development across products, services, projects and systems.
* Creates reference architectures focused on detailed design principles, decision points, detailed APIs, major systems and dependencies between business and IT.
* Manages and develops the architecture for a portfolio of projects or products, working closely with application development, network, infrastructure, security and operations teams.


Orchestrating Solutions Delivery


* Defines the principles, guidelines, standards, and solution patterns to ensure solution decisions are aligned with the enterprise's future-state architecture vision.
* Facilitates the evaluation and selection of software product standards and services, as well as the design of standard and custom software configurations.
* Monitors the current-state solution portfolio to identify deficiencies through aging application technologies.


Facilitating and Collaborating to Deliver Business Outcomes


* Provides consulting support to clinical and operational teams to assist with business capability alignment and technology product selection.
* Consults with application, infrastructure, and security teams on solution options analysis and technology selection.
* Supports the Enterprise Architect in the development of the IT architectural vision and roadmap to deliver against organizational objectives.
* Supports the development of best practices and frameworks for architecture definition, sizing, solution options analysis, UI/UX design, etc.
* Partners with the Enterprise Architect to establish domain-specific reference models for business and technology capabilities for use in strategic planning and analysis
* Participates in cross-functional discussions within the IT organization to develop an understanding of delivery and operational processes
Requirements:
Qualifications/Requirements:



To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily.



Requirements include:


* Bachelor's degree in computer science, information-technology, engineering, system analysis or a related field, or equivalent experience.
* Minimum of seven years of experience across IT solution development disciplines, including application development, middleware, database management and cloud development.
* Experience with cloud-based infrastructure architectures and design patterns.
* Experience with cloud-native application development and deployment in Azure, AWS or GCP.
* Exposure to multiple, diverse technologies, platforms, and processing environments.
* Good understanding of strategic and new and emerging technology trends, and the practical application of existing, new, and emerging technologies to new and evolving business and operating models.

* Good understanding of product management, agile principles and development methodologies and capability of supporting agile teams by providing advice and guidance on opportunities, impact, and risks, taking into account technical and architectural debt.
* Experience working in the Hospital & Healthcare industry is helpful, but not required.
* Experience developing architecture blueprints, strategies, and roadmaps.
* Experience delivering presentations to senior-level executives and technical audiences.
* Experience with architecture, design and implementation of cloud computing service models including SaaS, PaaS, and IaaS.
* Experience with business use cases leveraging AI / ML technology and frameworks.
* Experience with information modeling, database technologies and predictive analytics.
* Experience with systems integration across multiple platforms in a hybrid cloud environment.
* Knowledge of major EA frameworks such as TOGAF, Zachman, DoDAF.
* Knowledge of various backend development languages like .Net, Java, Go and Python.
* Knowledge of various database technologies such as MySQL, MongoDB, MS SQLServer and Oracle.
* Knowledge of various frontend web development languages such as JavaScript, HTML and CSS.
* Knowledge of various aspects of an enterprise technology architecture including business, information, data, network, and security.
* Knowledge of widely used cybersecurity frameworks such as NIST, ISO 27001 / 27002, SOC2, HIPA, FISMA, etc. and key security controls.
* Understanding and knowledge of SDLC methodologies (such as waterfall, spiral, agile software development, rapid prototyping, incremental, synchronize and stabilize, and DevOps).
* Knowledge and understanding of different modeling languages (such as UML, BPMN and ArchiMate).
* Understanding and knowledge of IT standards and general controls.
* Excellent analytical, planning, organizational and technical and skills.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Displays intellectual curiosity and integrity.
* Motivated and driven by achieving long-term business outcomes.
* Ability to work effectively in a team environment and partner with cross-functional teams.

title: Principal Enterprise Strategist
description:
**Who We Are**



WPS Health Solutions is a leading not-for-profit health insurer and federal government contractor headquartered in Wisconsin. WPS offers health insurance plans for individuals, families, seniors, and group health plans for small to large businesses. We process claims and provide customer support for beneficiaries of the Medicare program and manage benefits for millions of active-duty and retired military personnel across the U.S. and abroad. WPS Health Solutions has been making healthcare easier for the people we serve for more than 75 years. Proud to be military and veteran ready.


**Culture Drives Our Success**



WPS’ Culture is where the great work and innovations of our people are seen, fueled, and rewarded. We accomplish this by creating an inclusive and empowering employee experience. We recognize the benefits of Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion as an investment in our workforce—both current and future—to effectively seek, leverage, and include diverse perspectives that fuel agility and innovation on high-performing teams. This results in people bringing their authentic selves to work every day in an organization that successfully adapts to business changes and new opportunities.



From 2021 to 2024, WPS Health Solutions was recognized for several awards:


* Madison, Wisconsin’s Top Workplaces
* USA Top Workplaces and the cultural excellence awards for Remote Work and Work-Life Flexibility
* Achievers 50 Most Engaged Workplaces® with the further honor of Achievers “Elite 8” winner in the category of Culture Alignment
* DAV Patriot Employer
* VETS Indexes 4 Star Employer
* BBB Torch Award for Ethics from Better Business Bureau of Wisconsin


**Role Snapshot**

Our **Principal Enterprise Strategist** is responsible for providing market-backed, analytical research for senior corporate decision-makers on emerging and future-focused healthcare sector trends. You will facilitate dialogue with executive leadership to inform and shape WPS Health Solutions’ strategy development. Provide business related support, strategic analytics, and development of executive presentations. Projects will vary but may include evaluating and developing proposals for new industry initiatives, identifying changing industry dynamics, upcoming trends. You will evaluate business opportunities for both for strategic impact, building business cases to justify investments.


**Core components of this opportunity include the ability to:**

* Provide executive guidance to WPS’ Chief Growth Officer, and other executives, driving the company’s strategic and annual planning processes.
* Facilitate and assist in driving special projects and strategic initiative development throughout the organization.
* Establish project goals, milestones and procedures, define roles and responsibilities on projects, acquire project resources, coordinate all projects, monitor project progress to plan, manage multiple projects simultaneously.
* Analyze existing, macro and emerging healthcare regional and national trends and scenarios, technologies and industry disruptors and derive implications for our business strategies.
	+ Research subjects could include but are not limited to new sector mergers and acquisitions, new disruptors in the field, network models, innovative payment models, horizontal and vertical integrations of existing and emerging competitors, new and emerging technologies that improve care or reduce health insurer costs, best practices in specific aspects of care delivery, and leading companies that develop new and emerging technologies or care delivery best practices.
* Collaborate with Corporate Market Intelligence team, Corporate Development and other internal stakeholders and sources of data to research and find actionable insights.
* Develop a broad external network and build relationships with healthcare industry thought leaders to gain insights into federal health, healthcare delivery, health technology, clinical and pharmaceutical developments, population health, and insurance market structures.


**How do I know this opportunity is right for me? If you:**

* Are a highly motivated and outgoing critical thinker.
* Can foster trusting relationships and cultivate partnerships across the organization.
* Enjoy working in a goal-oriented and self-directed environment.
* Have a high degree of executive presence, emotional intelligence, and intellectual curiosity – with the ability to thrive in ambiguity.


**What will I gain from this role?**


* The opportunity to negotiate and collaborate with others of different skillsets, backgrounds, and levels within the organization to influence change.
* The ability to communicate across all levels of an organization and lead groups, conduct meetings, and facilitate team workshops.
* Experience working in an environment that serves our nation’s military, veterans, Guard and Reserves, and Medicare beneficiaries.
* Working in a continuous performance feedback environment.
* Experience working in an Agile environment to help drive high-priority work.


**Minimum Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s Degree in a Business-related concentration
* 7 or more years of experience leading enterprise strategies in healthcare as a management consultant, strategy consultant, business development professional, marketing analyst and/ or strategic planning analyst with demonstrated career progression and a deep understanding of the Healthcare business and operating models.


**Preferred Qualifications**

* Ability to forge strategic partnerships in the healthcare arena.
* A strong understanding of Business Development frameworks and processes in a healthcare environment.


**Salary Rang****e: $125K-$175K**


*The base pay offered for this position may vary within the posted range based on your job-related knowledge, skills, and experience.*


**Remote Work Requirements**


* High speed cable or fiber internet
* Minimum of 10 Mbps downstream and at least 1 Mbps upstream internet connection (can be checked at https://speedtest.net)
* Please review Remote Worker FAQs for additional information


**Work Location**



We are a remote-first organization and offer remote work in the following approved states:  

Arizona, Colorado, Connecticut, Florida, Georgia, Illinois, Indiana, Iowa, Michigan, Minnesota, Missouri, Nebraska, Nevada, New Jersey, North Carolina, North Dakota, Ohio, South Carolina, South Dakota, Texas, Virginia, Wisconsin


**Benefits**


* Remote and hybrid work options available
* Performance bonus and/or merit increase opportunities
* 401(k) with **dollar-per-dollar match up to 6% of salary** (100% vested immediately)
* Competitive paid time off
* Health insurance, dental insurance, and telehealth services start **DAY 1**
* Employee Resource Groups
* Professional and Leadership Development Programs
* Review additional benefits: (https://www.wpshealthsolutions.com/careers/fulltime\\_benefits.shtml)


**Sign up for** **Job Alerts**


**FOLLOW US!**


**Instagram**


**LinkedIn**


**Facebook**


Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities


The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

title: Solution Architect
description:
**Solution Architect**  

*(Military Veterans are highly encouraged to apply)*  

  

**Role Overview**  

BDR Solutions, LLC seeks a Solution Architect to join the BDR Growth Team. The Solution Architect will be responsible for leading and designing technical solutions, processes, and staffing mix within the domains of systems engineering, data and business analytics, data science, cyber security, management consulting, healthcare IT, and program management to create and craft high-quality technical solutions for written proposals, white papers, client engagements, and oral presentations. This position will report to the Senior Vice President of Growth. The ideal candidate will have experience serving in leadership roles on Federal IT proposals with prior experience serving as a technical solution architect or technical capture manager.  

  

**Responsibilities*** Assess technical requirements and objectives and design technical IT and management solutions applying industry best practices, frameworks, and technologies (e.g., DAMA DMBOK, Agile, Cloud, DevSecOps, low-code/no-code platforms, AI/ML, etc.) resulting in tailored solutions for integration into the written technical proposal, white papers, client presentations, and oral presentations.
* Apply analytics, problem-solving, and communication skills to identify best-fit technology solutions aligned to client requirements to deliver winning proposals to federal civilian, federal health, and other federal markets.
* Architect and design innovative, cost-effective technical solutions that meet and exceed customer requirements.
* Design approaches that optimize enterprise architecture across customer needs, business constraints, and technological implementation feasibility.
* Provide technical leadership and consulting level support on industry trends and standards on business and technical solutions.
* Provide facilitation for collaborative calls with partners, internal staff, and clients.
* Collect and process strategic plans, goals, and objectives for Veterans Affairs (VA), Department of Homeland Security, Department of Defense, and other Federal agencies.
* Collaborate with BDR Growth and Operations teams leading technical direction to support the business development lifecycle including pre-sales, capture, and proposal.
* Create technical solutions for proposals and manage technical response development by partnering with contributors from various internal and external teams via virtual and/or in-person meetings.
* Research and provide context and feasibility of solutions relative to customer business needs
* Support project start-up by performing technical interviews for resources to deliver work assignments.
* Lead technical aspects of the capture lifecycle including pre-proposal planning activities, kick-off meetings, value proposition conveyance, theme development, technical solution feasibility, technical writing, and technical reviews.
* Review/analyze proposal sections for consistency and clarity: Compliance with solicitation requirements, and alignment with proposed solutions and themes.
* Collaboratively work with business development, R&D, and operational leadership to obtain adequate resources for accomplishing high-quality proposal development in a timely manner.
* Ongoing improvements: Assist in the development and refinement of templates and standardized processes to streamline proposal development.

**Required Minimum Qualifications*** Demonstrate a minimum of 8+ years of experience in solution delivery, implementation, or engineering within DevSecOps, SDLC, Agile, Cloud optimization, and/or emerging technologies/capabilities (e.g., AI/ML, RPA, ZTA, etc.).
* In-depth business and technical knowledge of technology trends and standards in government IT and digital services transformation
* Experience leading technical discussions including the ability to take part in persuasive discourse with peers, partners, capture, pricing, and executive leadership
* Proven experience to architect technical solutions based on client requirements
* Ability to manage several proposals, projects, and priorities
* Experience and expertise within the Federal IT market space
* High level of expertise in Microsoft Office Suite (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and SharePoint).
* Proven excellent oral and written communication.

**Ideal Experience*** Proven experience working in a pace environment with a successful track record supporting proposals under VA T4NG, GSA MAS99 54151S, STARS III, and CIO-SP3.
* Dynamic interpersonal skills to interact with a variety of audiences (e.g., Executive management, subcontractors, technical and management staff)
* Demonstrated experience communicating clearly orally and in writing, and producing high-quality written products.
* Strong relationships with technology vendors or service providers


In addition, U.S. citizenship is required. Individuals will be subject to a background investigation including, but not limited to criminal history, employment and education verification, drug testing, and creditworthiness.  

BDR is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, marital status, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, or genetic information.  

  

  

**About BDR Solutions:**  

  

BDR Solutions delivers IT expertise and solutions that improve American lives through the modernization of government systems for health benefits, social services, and disaster relief. We are a service-disabled veteran-owned, 8(a), HUBZone small business—recognized for reliable and sustainable outcomes scaled to our client’s mission needs.

title: Lead Systems Analyst (Remote/Contract/Direct W2 Only)
description:
**Skills:**

* Lead level experience focused on systems and data analysis and application development.
* Experience designing solutions utilizing:

* Experience with System Modeling Tools: Sparx Enterprise Architect (preferred), Visio.

**Responsibilities:**

* Provides technical, business, and administrative direction for personnel performing software development tasks, including the review of work products for correctness, adherence to the design concept and to user standards, and for progress in accordance with project schedules.

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $75.00 - $85.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Experience level:

Schedule:
