title: Systems Architect
description:
Company Introduction  

9th Way Insignia is a service-disabled, veteran-owned small business bringing transformative technology to our government customers so they can achieve their missions. Our specialties include cybersecurity, cloud modernization, software development, data analytics, enterprise architecture, enterprise IT, analytics and artificial intelligence. Learn more about 9th Way Insignia at https://9thwayinsignia.com/  

  

Team (Project) Introduction  

9th Way Insignia will work with the Veterans Administration (VA) to support the governance pillar in creating, implementing, and providing support for the necessary requirements and outcomes of the Zero Trust assessments (ZTA). 9th Way Insignia will provide iterative updates for pillar use cases while accounting for a risk based and dependency-based priority of capabilities.  

  

Professional Level Information:  

The Technical Systems Architect aligns within 9th Way Insignia as a Level 4H Hybrid Manager/Lead. A Hybrid Manager at 9th Way Insignia accomplishes department objectives by managing staff and processes and evaluating department activities. Focuses on leading a team and working hands-on with projects involving technology. Hybrid Managers require skills and qualifications such as exceptional leadership, communication and interpersonal skills.  

  

Functional Job (LCAT) Information:  

An Expert Technical Systems Architect has extensive experience in the design and development of Client Server and Web Enabled Corporate applications including network topology. Must be well versed in Object Oriented tools and techniques. Must have thorough knowledge of data modeling skills using automated tools.  

  

Responsibilities:
* Provide technical leadership at an enterprise level to migrate legacy systems to a Zero Trust Architecture for the agency. Over 100 systems will need to be migrated to ZTA.
* Supports ZTA management team in recommending and creating technical solutions
* Will recommend security requirements and provide architectural direction to improve cybersecurity
* Will work with the Agency Enterprise Architect
* Provides system engineering and architectural design support services

Requirements*:*
* 10+ years of experience in cybersecurity
* Master of Science degree (or higher) in one of the following: computer science, electronics engineering, computer engineering, computer science, information technology, or cybersecurity or 10 years of additional experience
* Experience securing cloud-based systems
* Knowledge of Zero Trust Architecture
* Must have excellent interpersonal and technical skills as will be working with important stakeholders at all levels.


  

Preferred/Desired:
* CISSP
* GIAC Security Essentials Certification
* RMF, CSF, FISMA, and Fedramp
* Familiarity with: ZTNA and SASE Framework, ICAM (OKTA), CWPP, SOC Operations, Vulnerability Threat Management, and Compliance


  

Salary Range:  

The salary range for this position is$101,188 to 160,000.  

  

*9th Way Insignia’s range for this job level is a general guideline only and not a guarantee of compensation or salary. Additional factors considered in extending an offer include (but are not limited to) responsibilities of the job, education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities, as well as internal equity, alignment with market data, applicable bargaining agreement (if any), or other law.*  

  

Location:  

This position is remote.  

  

*9th Way Insignia reserves the right to adjust work location based upon mission requirements.*  

  

Clearance, background investigation:  

Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.  

  

Legal:  

We’re an equal employment opportunity/affirmative action employer that empowers our people to fearlessly drive change – no matter their race, color, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, lactation, or related medical conditions), national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, disability, veteran status, military or uniformed service member status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable federal, state, local, or international law.

title: Dynamics 365 F&O Solution Architect and Team Lead
description:
**Long View. A career that helps you get more out of life.**A Long View career helps you get more out of life. We don’t just say it, we prove it. Every day. We’re proud of our reputation as one of North America’s most dynamic IT providers — and we’re even prouder of our culture that allows our people to live life to its fullest. At Long View, we create an environment of collaboration and support, of innovation and enthusiasm, of inclusion and belonging. As a member of the Long View team, you’ll see how our company’s core pillars — Integrity, Competence, Value, and Fun — resonate through the workplace. And in a recent survey, 90% of Long View team members rated Long View as a good or great place to work! **Are you passionate about leading people and going above and beyond to deliver an exceptional experience for clients?**  

We are looking for Dynamics 365 F&O Solution Architect and Team Lead for Data and Dynamics team, leading the design and implementation of Dynamics 365 Finance and Operations solutions across the organization You will have a deep understanding of Dynamics 365 F&O functionalities, business processes, and industry best practices, along with strong leadership and communication skills to effectively manage a team of consultants and developers.
### **A Day in the Life:**

* Responsible for overseeing design, architecture, and implementation of various Dynamics 365 F&O solution components, as well as support efforts of solution consultants in other technical and business disciplines.
* Design, implement and Support Long View’s Business Application D365 Finance & Operation portfolio by working with customers and internal stakeholders (business clients, business analysts, developers, other architects), defining customer solutions, and delivering engagements that are innovative and exceed business requirements.
* Work with Marketing, Sales, and Digital Architects to identify growth opportunities and build sales strategies for identified opportunities.
* Proactively build a pipeline of opportunities to support the delivery of territory revenue targets.
* Maximize D365 Ongoing Support & Services delivery value to clients through regular reviews of utilization, working with clients, consultants, and scrum master’s to shape backlogs and ensure alignment to client success.
* Keep your team updated on exciting LVS news such as wins, growth, new branches, company direction and strategic sessions.
* Act as an escalation point for matters related to our offerings and lead or assist in the development of resolution plans as required.
* Provide direction and assistance to team members on how to deal with situations and issues on their own.

### **What You Bring:**

* 10+ years of industry experience working with Dynamics 365 F&O
* 5+ years of experience with Agile/Scrum
* Proven skills and background with Dynamics 365 F&O presales and demos
* Ability to effectively communicate to different audiences including internal and external stakeholders and peers clearly and concisely in written, oral and various presentation formats and situations.
* Proficiency in workshop facilitation (envisioning workshops, art-of-the-possible sessions.
* Self-motivation and drive, always looking for ways to improve skills and stay relevant in given area of expertise.

### **What Makes You Extra Awesome:**

* Post-secondary education
* Industry certifications such as Dynamics FastTrack, Microsoft MVP, Enterprise Architecture (TOGAF, Zachman), and relevant Azure experience across IaaS, PaaS, and SaaS solutions

### **Why Work at Long View?**

* **Great people and culture**
* **Fun is one of our cores values.**
* **Interesting work** – Be part of exciting projects while accessing all the latest technologies.
* **Flexible environment** – A workplace that values the importance of flexibility for personal/professional growth, happiness, and wellness.

**Want to learn more about our culture and life at Long View? Check us out on LinkedIn, Twitter and Instagram!** **Long View’s mission of building the best and most sustainable team-driven organization requires dedicated and ambitious people. Through employee resource groups, impactful and effective conversations, townhalls and various company-wide training, including how to reduce unconscious bias, we are fostering an inclusive environment. We are committed to taking consistent, positive and lifelong action to be a diverse and equitable workplace because we know that the most effective companies are made up of people with varied identities, experiences and backgrounds.**  

Long View is an equal opportunity employer. If you have any accommodation requests for your interview or the role, please let your friendly Recruiter know.

title: Enterprise Architect, North Central
description:
Zones is a Global Solution Provider of end-to-end IT solutions with an unmatched supply chain. Positioned to be the IT partner you need, Zones, a Minority Business Enterprise (MBE) in business for over 35 years, specializes in Digital Workplace, Cloud & Data Center, Networking, Security, and Managed/Professional/Staffing services. Operating in more than 120 countries, leveraging a robust portfolio, and utilizing the highest certification levels from key partners, including Microsoft, Apple, Cisco, Lenovo, Adobe, and more, Zones has mastered the science of building digital infrastructures that change the way business does business ensuring whatever they need, they can Consider IT Done. Follow Zones, LLC on Twitter @Zones, and LinkedIn and Facebook.

Zones is a dynamic and innovative technology solutions provider seeking a talented **Enterprise Architect** (EA) to join our high-impact PreSales technical solution team for the North Central Region of the US.
**Who you are:*** **An Experienced Presales Architect**: You understand what it means to be a true technical advisor and have a highly impactful client presence.
* **An Industry Expert:** Our capabilities and credentials span across our four areas: Digital Workplace, Cloud & Data Center, NextGen Networking, and Security.
* **A Story-Teller:** You possess the ability to differentiate between a client’s needs versus wants, understanding the ‘why’ before the ‘what’, and cross-sell the right combination of products and services that combines our physical supply chain and its related services through a consultative approach.
* **A Problem Solver:** With advanced analytical and solutioning skills, you will ensure that the solution proposed by the Solutions Architect has been designed, estimated, and priced right.
* **A Strategist:** As an integral player in our growth strategy for 2024 and beyond, the successful candidate will spearhead initiatives, lead with strategic vision, and craft cutting-edge solutions for substantial Professional and Managed Services opportunities."

**Responsibilities:**
**Collaboration with Sales Team:*** Work closely with the sales team to uncover and develop product, service and solutions (combination of products + services) opportunities. The EA will participate, as part of the sales process, in the early stages of an opportunity
* The EAs responsibility will be to uncover the clients needs and weave a story of what’s possible to provide vision and direction for what is required today while establishing a path for tomorrow.
* The EA must understand how to shape an opportunity to include offering beyond the initial requirements to include offering from other practices.

**Solution Design:*** Leverage the right Solution Architects in one or more of our four practices to perform a detailed Discovery and create the right solution at the right price.
* Ensure the solution developed by the Practice Architect(s) meets the requirements captured during your meeting with the client. While EA is not responsible to develop the proposal/SOW/pricing calculator, the EA is responsible for the deliverable back to the client.
* Understand the clients’ needs and help determine the price to win.
* Stress test the solution before submitting it to the client.
* Orchestrate meetings to enable the Practice Solution Architect to present our proposal to the client and ensure that feedback is incorporated if we need to submit a more refined proposal.

**Technical Leadership:*** The EA needs to remain on the forefront of technology and the related services.
* Your understanding of how clients could leverage these modern technological advances will be used to guide opportunities.

**Collaboration with Stakeholders:*** The EA must become a Trusted Advisor, be a Client Advocate
* The EA must develop their own relationships within the supported accounts.
* Collaborate seamlessly with stakeholders such as Solution Architects, Project Managers, Delivery Engineers, and clients to ensure successful implementation of our projects.
* Communicate effectively to address concerns, answer queries, and provide ongoing support.
* The EA is intended to be the first in and the last out. The EA must own our opportunities from inception to the final closing.

**What you Bring:*** 7+ years of professional experience in Information Technology Presales or Solution Architecture with leading Technology Consulting firms. Experience and knowledge should be deep in one or more of the four practices we focus on, with working knowledge in the remaining practice areas.
* Proven track record in managing multi-million-dollar deals spanning Products, Professional Services, and Managed Services.
* Ability to articulate solutions persuasively in written responses, solution presentations, and oral presentations to clients.
* Deep understanding of services cost and price benchmarks.
* Demonstrated strong analytical, organizational, and leadership skills.
* Experience working collaboratively in a globally distributed team.



Join us at Zones and be a key player in shaping the future of our technology solutions, driving services revenue growth, enhancing client satisfaction, and contributing to the realization of ambitious revenue targets. This is more than a job; it's an opportunity to architect success on a grand scale.

#LI-LM1

#LI-Remote

Zones offers a comprehensive Benefits package

While we’re committed to providing top-tier solutions, we’re just as committed to supporting our own team. Our employees enjoy a variety of comprehensive benefits, including medical/dental/vision coverage, life insurance, a 401(k) plan with matching provision, paid time off, and much more. And as a Minority Business Enterprise, a Corporate Plus member of the Northwest Minority Supplier Development Council, and an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer, our community is just as diverse.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status or on the basis of disability.

At Zones, work is more than a job –with exciting careers with a global team who are client centric, have a passion for tech, who embrace change and lifelong learning in a collaborative culture. If you’re interested in working on the cutting edge of IT innovation, sales, engineering, operations, administration, and more, Zones is the place for you!

title: Senior Enterprise & Segment Architect - Remote
description:
The above salary range represents a general guideline; however, Sierra7 considers a number of factors when determining base salary offers such as the scope and responsibilities of the position and the candidate's experience, education, skills and current market conditions.  


***Why Join Sierra7?***

Sierra7 is a Small Disabled Veteran Owned Business, founded in 2009 with the mission of "Serving those who Serve". Also ranked No. 457 out of 5,000 fastest growing private companies in America by Inc. Apply today and help us with our mission of "Serving those who Serve".

  


***Benefits:***



* 401K



* Legal Assistance
  

* Medical/Dental/Vision



Financial Wellness  

* 
  

* FSA (Flexible Spending Account)



* Paid Time Off (PTO)
  

* HSA (Health Savings Account)



* Federal Holidays
  

* Life Insurance, Voluntary Life Insurance, Voluntary Short- and Long-Term Disability



* Education Reimbursement
  

* Additional Supplemental Medical Benefits



* LinkedIn Learning

  

  


***About this role:***

In support to the Veterans Administration (VA), the Senior Enterprise / Segment Architects will analyze, cost, and recommend the right combination of VA approved IT components to achieve a specific business, department, team, or functional goal. This position provides software and system architecture recommendations to improve and enhance the existing architecture. The Senior Enterprise / Segment Architects will analyze the current environment and recommend/implement business and data architecture changes. The Senior Enterprise / Segment Architects must objectively analyze the desired processes and outcomes; identify costs and benefits; advise on the right combination of IT systems and components to achieve those goals; and prepare related enterprise architecture artifacts.

  


### **Position Responsibilities:**

* Understand VA Enterprise Architecture objectives and ensure the program is in alignment
* Provide recommendations for Enterprise Architecture standards, practice, tools, and technologies (including DODAF and TOGAF)
* Understand enterprise level initiatives and principles (such as Product Line Management (PLM), DevSecOps, Digital Transformation, Application Modernization, Cloud Platform, Network as a Service (NaaS), Software as a Service (SaaS), Robotic Process Automation (RPA))
* Identify client needs and make suggestions regarding technical direction
* Design, document, and implement System Security and Data Assurance Processes and Procedures
* Support development of a data strategy, data policies, data architecture, and data standards and procedures and document these results in the Data Governance and Management Documents
* Support the adoption of an Open Data Framework to enable a modern and scalable data architecture
* Work with different level of program, project, and technical leads to support and build products using VA’s enterprise standards
* Acquire expert understanding of the as-is architecture of all systems in the program
* Perform system gap analysis to identify areas where the system can add additional value and incorporate results into the system design
* Understand VA Enterprise requirements and map with enterprise architecture to build future state solutions.
* Validate and, where required, document the to-be state of systems and solutions with stakeholder input
* Analyze and assess existing and future system architectures and designs against the Technical Reference Model (TRM) and VA Enterprise Design Patterns to gauge compliance with the IT strategic direction
* Create system designs that include system schematics, including system and subsystem performance-based descriptions and key interfaces between them, and interfaces to the existing software interfaces
* Create architecture artifacts including conceptual diagrams and reference models
* Communicate architecture to stakeholders and team members in a format that will demonstrate functionality, assist development teams, and achieve customer acceptance
* Communicate with stakeholders, and partnering system representation, to arrive at consensus solutions and compromise resolutions for problems that may arise from technical interfaces and functional dependencies
* Provide technical support for VA Enterprise Architecture review meetings and decisions

  

* 10 years’ relevant experience as aSenior Enterprise / Segment Architect for large systems
* Experience working in the Veterans Administration (VA) or other Government agency (preferred)
* Experience in design and development of IT architecture including a wide range of work in creating diagrams and documentation with all components that comprise IT systems including cloud-based architecture (Azure and/or AWS), Network as a Service (NaaS), and/or Software as a Service (SaaS)
* Understanding of how to apply state-of-the-art solutions to modify systems using a user-centered design and implementation approach
* Understanding of industry trends

  


### **Qualifications:**

* Master’s degree in computer science, engineering, engineering management, math, or similar technical discipline (10 years of experience may be substituted for education)
* Ability to obtain a Government Public Trust Tier 4 / High Risk security clearance

  

This posting is for prospective candidates only. Unsolicited third-party resume submissions will be considered property of Sierra7, Inc. and will not be acknowledged or returned.

title: Senior or Lead Architect Remote Eligible
description:
Southwest Power Pool (SPP) is about more than power. We’re about the power of relationships. Our employees have the opportunity to work together to ensure electricity is delivered reliably and affordably to the millions of people living in our service territory. We have been voted one of Arkansas’ Best Places to work by Arkansas Business and we are looking for a member of our team who is passionate about our mission to keep the lights on!



We have a core ideology here at SPP that we stand by: Do the right thing, for the right reason, in the right way.



We believe in supporting our employees through a fantastic benefits package:


* Competitive pay with bonus opportunities
* Excellent insurance package including three great medical plans to choose from, employer-paid short term disability, long term disability, and life insurance
* Relocation assistance
* Flexible working environment for positions that are eligible where employees have the flexibility to work from home and come in where collaborative in person work is needed.
* Fantastic contributions to your retirement through a 401(k) savings plan with employer-match benefits and a defined benefit plan fully funded by SPP


**We are seeking a highly skilled Senior or Lead Cloud Architect to join our team. As key contributor you will:**



Be responsible for modernizing the architecture of applications in our production environment. It's important to note that this is not an application support role. Instead, you will be tasked with identifying areas within our production application infrastructure that would benefit from replacement, retirement, or rebuilding. Rather than focusing on a single application for an extended period, this role will constantly present new challenges as you architect modernization solutions. Some recent projects have included consolidating and replacing our collaboration tools with Microsoft Teams, architecting our HW/SW asset inventory system, and automating portions of our DevOps pipeline.



The company's growth has been rapid, and it has now reached a significant turning point where it is adopting many of the formal disciplines of a larger, more mature IT organization. The Enterprise Architecture (EA) organization at SPP is relatively young, being around 4 years old, but it has strong executive support and is already making a significant impact on the security, efficiency, and reliability of our IT infrastructure. We embrace modern practices such as cloud adoption, DevOps, Data Analytics, and Container orchestration, which means that you will have the opportunity to work with the latest technologies and best practices.



We believe this role offers an exciting opportunity to work on cutting-edge projects and contribute to the continued growth and success of our organization. If you are a dedicated and experienced Architect seeking an exciting challenge, we invite you to apply.


**To be successful as the Senior or Lead Cloud Architect, we're looking for:**


* Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology or related field or equivalent experience
* Lead Architect: Twelve (12) plus years of applicable experience in IT involving systems/software architecture, design, development and deployment
* Senior Architect: Eight (8) years of applicable experience in IT involving systems/software architecture, design, development, and deployment
* Experience documenting systems and software architectures using modeling languages (UML, E-R diagrams, etc.)
* Expert written and oral communication skills
* Experience in hardware and software evaluation principles, practices, and guidelines
* Experience in requirements gathering and developing strategic plans
* Expert technical architecture, support, and documentation skills
* Expert analytical and problem solving abilities


**Preferred:**


* Experience with FinOps for metered services in the cloud (implementation and/or administration)


**Position Type and Expected Hours of Work:**



This is a full-time position. Days and hours of workweek are Monday through Friday; 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. Working extended hours may be required.


**Travel Requirement:**



This position requires minimal travel (10%).



SPP is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer of individuals with disabilities and protected veterans and is committed to excellence. If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process, please contact us at HR@spp.org and let us know the nature of your request. We will only respond to messages left that involve a request for a reasonable accommodation in the application process. We will accommodate the needs of any qualified candidate who requests a reasonable accommodation under the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA).



At SPP we value Diversity, Equity and Inclusion. Visit our website to learn more: LINK



Full job descriptions will be made available to those selected for an interview.

#### **Education**


Preferred* Bachelors or better


Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities

title: Enterprise Architect
description:
C1 Company Overview:
**C1: 1 Contact, 1 Connection, 1 Choice**  

C1 is the foremost, single-source provider of advanced communications and data technology for business. That means if it's digital, we connect our customers to it - from phone systems and hardware to computer networks, application development, managed solutions and more. And we're 100% passionate with designing, implementing, managing and supporting our customers' every need from end to end, so that they can focus on what they do best.  

So, when it comes to joining a team of IT and communications technology pros who are empowered to do what they do best, your best choice - your #1 choice - is C1.
Overview:
**Summary**


An Enterprise Architect (EA) focuses on the big picture, creating technology strategies that enhance connectivity and human experiences across the entire organization. An Enterprise Architect is the technical lead for the customer that transcends the Account Executive and is the primary technical contact for the customer. The position is responsible for assessing customer needs and tailoring customized solutions that are moderate to complex in nature to fit business needs. The Enterprise Architect is well versed in all market offerings in their area of expertise and works closely with the account team to ensure full accuracy of the solution design during the lifecycle of the sale. Also, this position can explain, position, and justify costs related to ConvergeOne’s solutions.


Responsibilities:
**Essential Functions**

* Develops and advises on enterprise architecture models
* Aligns technology initiatives with business objectives/experiences
* Advises on technology trends and innovations
* Validates solution discovery requirements and aligns them to customer outcomes/experience
* Presents C1’s entire portfolio and C1 (ConvergeOne) “Human Experience” story
* Collaborates closely with key customers and maintains key technical relationships with customers
* Collaborates closely with Account Executives, forming synergistic partnerships that ensures a unified approach to customer needs, from solution crafting to account management
* Leads technical teams (Design Engineers, Solution Architects, Chief Advisors, Delivery Engineers, Project Managers and Managed Services engineers)
* Oversees and responsible for the whole sales cycle, serving deals from discovery through project execution and supporting adoption in partnership with Services, PM and Lifecycle teams
* Acts as the main orchestrator behind any major deal, ensuring that all elements of the deal from initial customer requirements to final implementation plans are seamlessly integrated
* Interacts directly with key customers, virtually and preferably in-person, to build relationships, lead projects (pre-Sales, Post-sales, and Managed Services) and ensure C1 success
* Maintains ongoing engagement with customers who consume managed services, ensuring that their evolving needs are consistently met and that our solution continues to align with their long-term objectives
* Remains connected to assigned customers, including between projects

 **Additional Specific Duties and Responsibilities**


Accustomed to working in virtual office environment
Qualifications:
**Required Qualifications**

* Extensive experience in enterprise-level projects
* Strong strategic thinking and leadership skills
* Ability to relate to customers’ needs and showing understanding and insight
* Ability to function as trusted advisor and build long-lasting trustworthy relationships with customers
* Demonstrates comprehensive technical abilities across various domains and across numerous services models (pre-sales, Delivery and Managed)
* Deep understanding of enterprise architecture frameworks, cloud computing, Collaboration, and Infrastructure design
* Ability to work independently with minimal direction providing accurate solution architecture for clients
* Ability to communicate with all levels, including executive levels, with customers and partners, and bridge the gap between business users and information technology
* Excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills to convey complex technical details in a manner understandable to non-technical stakeholders; excellent relationship and collaborations skills
* Competency in negotiating with vendors, team members, and stakeholders to reach optimal outcomes
* Ability to adapt to new challenges and technologies; staying updated with industry trends
* Ability in prioritizing tasks and projects to meet deadlines without compromising quality
* Ability to identify and assess technical risks and create mitigation strategies
* Ability to mentor, guide, and manage technical teams, ensuring that projects are executed efficiently
* Certifications or equivalent experience in area of focus

Proficient at all Microsoft Office products; Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, and SharePoint  
* 

Additional Information:
**C1 BENEFITS**  

  

* 401(k) Plan (35% match per dollar up to 10%)
* Medical Coverage (3 plan options, no network - all providers are covered, includes comprehensive member advocacy; & Kaiser CA plan option)
* HSA + Employer Contribution
* In-vitro Fertility (treatment coverage)
* Dental
* Vision
* FSA Plans
* Pre-tax Commuter Plans
* Employer-paid Life Insurance
* Employer-paid Short + Long Term Disability
* Paid Parental Leave (4 weeks at 100%)
* Employee Assistance Plan
* Voluntary Life Insurance
* Legal/ID Theft Plans
* TeleHealth Options
* Omada Health (healthy living solution)
* Travel Assistance
* Business Travel Accident Coverage
* Employer-paid Pet Telehealth
* Accident Insurance
* Critical Illness Insurance
* Hospital Indemnity Insurance
* Health Advocate
* Volunteer Time Off

  

**Work Environment**  

Ability to handle multiple priorities and demands in a fast-paced environment. This job operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, and filing cabinets.  

  

**Physical Environment**  

Physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by a team member to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of this job.  

  

**Other Duties/Changes**  

This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of all duties, responsibilities or activities that are required of a team member for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice. At any point in time, the essential functions and primary duties associated with this position will be the principal, major or most important duties, responsibilities and activities that the employee is expected to perform as determined and directed by C1.  

  

**EEO Statement**  

C1 provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all team members and applicants for employment opportunities. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment, and all team members will be treated with respect to their employment, without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status. For further details please view the Equal Employment Opportunity Posters provided by OFCCP. http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/ofccpost.htm **Pay Range**
$110,000 - $160,000
Base pay ranges are estimated. Actual base pay will be based on education, experience, location, certifications, skill set, and any other relevant factors. Incentive/variable pay opportunities are in addition to base pay. **Notice of E-Verify Participation**

title: Enterprise Architect
description:
**Job Title: Enterprise Architect IV****Location: Detroit Michigan 48226**  

Detroit, Charlotte or open to remote candidates. \\*\\* Enterprise Architect IV; \\*\\* Exceptional critical thinking skills; \\*\\* broad technical depth; \\*\\* Public Cloud knowledge and technologies. \\*\\* \\*\\*Must have excellent communication skills and work well independently self-motivated but also able to work collaboratively. \\*\\*Tech screen and zoom interview. **Description:**This is an advanced technical position that requires a minimum of 10 or more years of yearsand#39; experience in the design, architecture, and implementation of high-performance e-commerce and financial systems and services. This position will be responsible for conceptualizing and designing innovative end-to-end software architectures that enable critical strategic objectives. Designs produced must meet both business and non-functional requirements while aligning to standard reference architectures. **The Work Itself**
Primary accountability for the position involves establishing and driving clear, effective, and innovative solution designs aligning reference architectures, blueprints, and business and IT strategies across the technology and enterprise landscape.
Act as SME for project teams in the planning, design, and delivery of technology solutions
In application architecture: design the inter- system/application structures, advise teams of Ally standard requirements, security standards, methodology and processes.
In business architecture: define cross-business function processes, advise teams of consistent processes and common business functions.
Serve as an esteemed technical mentor to architecture and software development colleagues.
Provide cost effective solutions that enable the business and maximize flexibility to integrate with other systems.
Participate in proof of concepts to support the development of architecture principles, styles, patterns and standards for systems across the business, translating corporate strategy into technical strategy.
Lead cross-functional team to drive peer reviews, gain consensus, and finalize proposed solutions with all stakeholders.
Communicate and validate architecture technical leadership, program management, business line leadership, and executive level stakeholders.
Review legacy architecture, identify components strategically aligned for re-architecture, monitor technology usage for end-of-life cycle. **Skills:****Mandatory Skills**
7+ years of experience in solutions architect roles, with in-depth knowledge of standards and technologies in IT architecture and infrastructure including Information Security Policy and Procedures, and the software development process.
Effective communicator with other senior leaders of IT on program strategies and plans and negotiate quality solutions.
Expert knowledge of enterprise platforms, operating systems, and key business functions and processes Understanding of industry trends and new technologies and ability to apply trends to architectural needs.
Ability to lead or interact with and provide architectural design guidance to project teams made up of employee, business partner, and/or supplier resources. A minimum of two years experience driving microservices based, Event Driven applications.
Demonstrated experience developing high performance applications relying on RDBMS and NoSQL technologies.
Demonstrated experience with React/AngularJS. **Desired Skills**
Experience with cloud migrations, particularly with AWS; related certifications a plus
Containerization experience with any of the following: Docker, Kubernetes, Open Shift, Oracle, etc.
Experience with professional grade architecture modeling and/or landscaping tools (e.g., BizzDesign, Archi)
Bachelors degree in computer science, Information Systems, or other relevant field of study **Thanks and Regards,**
Manala Priyanka
US IT Recruiter
Lucid Technologies Inc
Email: priyanka.m@lucidtechinc.com
W: www.LucidTechINC.com

title: Intergration Enterprise Architect
description:
Since 1869 we've connected people through food they love. Our history was created by remarkable people, ideas, and innovations. It serves as inspiration and foundation for our future success. We’re proud to be stewards of amazing brands that people trust. We foster a culture of belonging where people come first, and diversity is embraced. And we live our values, always, while setting the highest standards for performance.
Here, you will make a difference every day. You will be part of a dynamic, collaborative, and competitive team. You will be supported to build a rewarding career with opportunities to grow, innovate and inspire. Make history with us.
What role will you play? How will you make history with Campbell’s? Apply today!
Imagine…
working for a company that knows that its people are the key to its success in the marketplace. A company in which achieving extraordinary results and having stimulating work experience are part of the same process. We cultivate and embrace a diverse employee population. We recognize that people with diverse backgrounds, experiences and perspectives fuel our growth and enrich our global culture.
Who we are looking for…
Responsible for planning, coordination, development, and supervision of all activities related to the integration of software programs, applications, and third-party solutions to meet the business requirements of the organization. The integration needs are primarily focused on connecting on-premises and cloud-based commercial software applications. This individual is also responsible for developing and maintaining an application integration architecture blueprint for the organization. This role is focused on creating EI strategies, reusable service layers, standardizing and governing enterprise integration space.
What you will do...* Responsible for creating and overseeing Enterprise Integration Strategy
* Lead and consult on establishment of the Enterprise Integration COE
* Develop EA standards, EA governance frameworks, and system integration standards
* Define, publish and maintain enterprise integration standards, integration patterns, decision trees etc.
* Provide expert advice to project teams on use of integration technology, data architecture and modeling, system architecture including integration best practices
* Oversee critical steps within the Software Development Life Cycle components that impact enterprise-wide integration development / architecture standards
* Provide oversight in standards adherence through reviews of project work including detailed technical specifications and application code
* Work with project teams in definition of requirements for integration strategies of their projects into the Enterprise Architecture
* Create designs and oversee implementation of enterprise integration capabilities
* Assist with incident response, troubleshooting, root cause analysis, and problem resolution
* Partner with leaders of other disciplines to ensure proposed solutions align with information, technology, infrastructure, business and security architectures
* Occasional regional travel
* All other projects and duties as required or assigned


What you bring to the table…* BS in Computer science or related discipline
* 7+ years of Enterprise Architecture experience
* Demonstrated expertise in designing enterprise integration strategies
* Expert level knowledge and experience designing and building reusable integration patterns, microservices and APIs
* Expertise in design and development of event driven architecture.
* Expert level knowledge of Azure Integration Services
* Working knowledge of SAP BTP platform (Foundary)
* Broad understanding of virtualized infrastructure, hosting environments, and cloud services PaaS
* Deep understanding of enterprise application integration (EAI) strategy and platform architecture
* Technical expert: Azure Integration Services, SAP BTP
* Expert level knowledge and experience with cloud native integration strategies, security protocols etc.


More About the Job* Reports to Senior Director, Enterprise Architecture & Digital Solutions


Compensation and Benefits:
The target base salary range for this full-time, salaried position is between
$105,000-$172,200
Individual base pay depends on work location and additional factors such as experience, job-related skills, and relevant education or training. Total pay may include other forms of compensation. In addition, we offer competitive health, dental, 401k and wellness benefits beginning on the first day of employment. Please ask your Talent Acquisition Partner for more information about our total rewards package.
The Company is committed to providing equal opportunity for employees and applicants in all aspects of the employment relationship, without regard to race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, citizenship, marital status, veteran status, disability, age, religion, or any other classification protected by law.
In that regard, U.S. applicants and employees are protected from discrimination based on certain categories protected by Federal law.

title: Integrations Enterprise Architect
description:
Overview:
**W****hy Valvoline Global Operations?**
Valvoline Global is a worldwide leader in automotive and industrial solutions, creating future-ready products and best-in-class services for partners around the globe. Established in 1866, we introduced the world’s first branded motor oil, claiming our position as The Original Motor Oil.  

As an affiliate of Aramco, one of the world's largest integrated energy and chemicals companies, we continue to invest strategically and expand globally, driving unparalleled product innovation and sustainable business solutions.  

Our corporate values of **care**, **integrity**, **passion**, and **excellence** shape everything we do. Living out our values is what makes our company, our employees, our partners, our customers, and the communities we serve great.  

When you join Valvoline Global, you join a culture that is committed to: treating all people with care, operating with integrity, striving for excellence in everything we do, and showing passion about delivering on our commitments. **Careers for the Driven**


Valvoline has a rewarding opportunity as an **Integrations Enterprise Architect**. We whole-heartedly adopt a ‘never idle' mindset. We also know that outstanding service begins and ends with our employees. So, we’re looking for good people to join our team. You bring your skills, talents, and drive. We will give you a great place to work, a competitive salary and benefits, and the resources and support to develop and advance within our global company.  

An Integrations Enterprise Architect specializes in designing and implementing solutions for system and data integration within an organization. They focus on developing strategies for connecting disparate IT systems, ensuring efficient data flow and consistency. This role involves crafting robust integration architectures, staying updated with the latest technologies, and collaborating with other IT professionals. The architect solves complex integration challenges, oversees integration projects, and ensures compliance with security and data standards, playing a key role in aligning IT infrastructure with business objectives.

 **How You’ll Make an Impact**

  

* Strategic Planning: They develop and execute strategies for integrating disparate IT systems to improve efficiency and data consistency across the enterprise.
* Design and Architecture: Designing robust architecture for integrating different systems, ensuring scalability, security, and performance.
* Technology Expertise: Staying abreast of the latest integration technologies and trends, including cloud services, APIs, middleware, and data formats.
* Collaboration and Communication: Working closely with other IT professionals, such as system architects, developers, and analysts, to understand their needs and ensure that integration solutions meet business goals.
* Problem-Solving and Innovation: Identifying and solving complex integration challenges, often requiring innovative approaches and custom solutions.
* Technology Roadmap – Mapping out the technology roadmap for Valvoline (Integrations, participation in overall technology roadmaps, global)
* Compliance and Best Practices: Ensuring that integration solutions comply with industry standards and best practices for security, data integrity, and reliability.

**What You’ll Need**

* Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university with major coursework in computer science, information management, or a related field
* Minimum of 10 years (10-15 preferred) of IT experience working with interface technologies
* 5 -10 full cycle project implementations of integrations technology.
* 4+ years leadership experience on technology projects.
* 5 years experience with end to end DEVOPS or Continuous Integration / Continuous Deployment change control processes.
* 5 years experience with Open Source interface components.
* Middleware
* APIs
* Data Integration Tools
* Cloud Integrations Tools
* Microservices and Containers
* Webhooks
* IoT Integration Platforms
* Robotic Process Automation
* Event-Driven Architecture
* SAP BTP and CPI
* Mulesoft
* Webmethods
* Ability to travel up to 10%
* Must be authorized to work in the U.S.

**What Will Set You Apart**

* Masters Degree

**Benefits That Drive Themselves**

* Health insurance plans (medical, dental, vision)
* HSA and flexible spending accounts
* 401(k)
* Incentive opportunity\\*
* Life insurance
* Short and long-term disability insurance
* Paid vacation and holidays\\*
* Employee Assistance Program
* Employee discounts
* Tuition reimbursement\\*
* Adoption assistance\\*
* *Terms and conditions apply, and benefits may differ* *depending on position.*

  

Valvoline provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. Are you good at what you do? Join us.

  

The Company endeavors to make its recruitment process accessible to any and all users. Reasonable accommodations will be provided, upon request, to applicants with disabilities in order to facilitate equal opportunity throughout the recruitment and selection process. Please contact Human Resources at 1-800-Valvoline or email 1-800Valvoline@valvoline.com to make a request for reasonable accommodation during any aspect of the recruitment and selection process. The contact information is for accommodation requests only; do not use this contact information to inquire about the status of applications.

title: Enterprise Architect, Healthcare Systems & Technologies
description:
**This is where you save and sustain lives**

At Baxter, we are deeply connected by our mission. No matter your role at Baxter, your work makes a positive impact on people around the world. You’ll feel a sense of purpose throughout the organization, as we know our work improves outcomes for millions of patients.


Baxter’s products and therapies are found in almost every hospital worldwide, in clinics and in the home. For over 85 years, we have pioneered significant medical innovations that transform healthcare.


Together, we create a place where we are happy, successful and inspire each other. This is where you can do your best work.


Join us at the intersection of saving and sustaining lives— where your purpose accelerates our mission.

**Your role at Baxter**
-----------------------

Nothing changes if nothing changes, which is why Baxter is transforming our global IT function—into one that will strengthen partnerships and enable smarter, more efficient and connected business processes. In the dynamic healthcare industry, we need to be ready to face new challenges and opportunities. As we learn, we must be agile and innovative to reveal new ways of working. Technology and our digital capability will help create a more efficient and innovative ecosystem to enable our employees, customers and products to drive better outcomes for patients worldwide.


We are at the critical intersection where robust IT infrastructure and networking support meets the physicians, nurses and care givers who save and sustain lives. Together, we can build upon Baxter’s rich heritage to advance the next generation of transformative healthcare innovations. Together, we can change how IT meets healthcare. Together, we are Baxter.


This is where technology fuels purpose-driven work. Where your purpose accelerates our mission.

**Your Team**
-------------


The Enterprise Architect proactively and holistically helps and guides the enterprise leaders, product managers, product owners and distributed product delivery teams through transformation and optimization initiatives, supporting the formulation of business strategy, outcomes and capabilities. Your scope of activities could include helping the organization achieve targeted business outcomes related to growing revenue, optimizing costs, mitigating risks and improving sustainability. You will be using techniques such as Tech Blueprinting, Capability Mapping, Benchmarking, and Research - develop overall Enterprise Architecture recommendations to align to Baxter EA standards and governance.

**What you'll be doing**
------------------------

* Through collaboration with Business Relationship Managers, and Manufacturing Relationship Managers align and optimize Healthcare Systems and Technologies (HST) business capabilities and processes to IT Strategy. Including gathering and managing demands from the HST segment, identifying segment priorities through EA Domains and value stream mapping to support key objectives, and establishing segment-level strategic blueprints for the future.
* Rationalization of existing technologies including the identification of opportunities for consolidation, cost-savings, and simplification, and management of actions to achieve.
* Support and follow policies and governance as aligned to technology risk and architecture.
* Maintain the alignment, integration, and coordination of architecture activities across different programs, projects and products as they evolve over time.
* Facilitate business and IT alignment, connecting strategy to execution, through a cohesive, encouraging, and consultative manner, driving the organization’s digital business strategies and balancing innovation and growth.
* Lead and facilitate interaction with business & IT leaders in a conversation over the risks and implications of product decisions to the line of business, business unit and greater enterprise.
* Develop and apply minimal viable architectures, which can include a set of standards, reference architecture patterns, principles, and guardrails, through the EA governance model, which is advised by the business strategy and corporate governance. Clarifies accountability and provides the focal point for agile, effective, and efficient decision making.
* Facilitates a cohesive relationship across architecture community, product management and product delivery teams by providing freedom-in-a-box for decision making, with the minimal viable architecture forming the boundaries of the box.
* Collaborate with delivery teams to ensure consistency with enterprise architecture, as well as to leverage shared technologies, tools and processes that impact speed to value and time to market.
* Collaborate with infrastructure teams to ensure consistency with the enterprise architecture, as well as to identify when it is vital to modify the enterprise architecture.
* Collaborate with global EA core team to ensure the application portfolio management data are up to date for the accountable EA domains.
* Handle the analysis of business and operating models, market trends and the technology industry to resolve their potential impact on the enterprise’s business strategy, direction, and architecture.
* Lead analysis of the business’ future-state capabilities and future (and current) IT environment to detect critical gaps and opportunities and recommend solutions for improvement to drive the business towards its targeted outcomes.
* Scan new technologies and the business ecosystem for major innovative technology and non-technology trends (trend spotting) bringing them forward for future consideration and proving out.

**What you'll bring**
---------------------

* Bachelor’s degree in related field required.
* 10+ years of architecture or equivalent experience.
* Experience working with technology vendors.
* Expertise in healthcare and connected technology solutions.
* Broad expertise in Infrastructure, Cloud and Network services
* Knowledge of business domains. Experience in architecture models.
* Experience implementing new technologies into enterprise environments.
* Knowledge of IT governance and operations.
* Enterprise Integration technologies and patterns.

*Baxter is committed to supporting the needs for flexibility in the workplace. We do so through our flexible workplace policy which includes a minimum of 3 days a week onsite. This policy provides the benefits of connecting and collaborating in-person in support of our Mission.*


We understand compensation is an important factor as you consider the next step in your career. At Baxter, we are committed to equitable pay for all employees, and we strive to be more transparent with our pay practices. The estimated base salary for this position is $112,000 to $154,000 annually. The estimated range is meant to reflect an anticipated salary range for the position. We may pay more or less than of the anticipated range based upon market data and other factors, all of which are subject to change. Individual pay is based on upon location, skills and expertise, experience, and other relevant factors. This position may also be eligible for discretionary bonuses. For questions about this, our pay philosophy, and available benefits, please speak to the recruiter if you decide to apply and are selected for an interview.


#LI-VF1


The successful candidate for this job may be required to verify that he or she has been vaccinated against COVID-19, subject to reasonable accommodations for individuals with medical conditions or religious beliefs that prevent vaccination, and in accordance with applicable law.

**Equal Employment Opportunity**


Baxter is an equal opportunity employer. Baxter evaluates qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, disability/handicap status or any other legally protected characteristic.  

  

EEO is the Law  

EEO is the law - Poster Supplement

title: IT Solution Architect – SAP TPM
description:
**Kimberly-Clark USA, LLC**

**IT Solution Architect – SAP TPM**

**Job Description**:


IT Solution Architect – SAP TPM positions offered by Kimberly-Clark USA, LLC (previously operating as Kimberly-Clark Global Sales LLC) (Roswell, GA). Coordinate medium to complex solution architecture implementations including design variances based upon business needs while ensuring artifacts are documented in enterprise architecture repository. Translate non-functional and functional requirements into end-to-end analytical solution designs, ensuring solutions aligns with business goals and processes, use and provide enterprise information consistently. Coordinate complex SAP TPM Suite including SAP CRM, SAP BW Reporting, SAP UDF/CAR, Middleware, SAP BW Process Chains, UI5, and SAP CRM claims. Integrate solution designs effectively with other applications to support a common application environment and user interaction model. Coordinate engagements with vendors as they relate to evaluation, design and delivery of business capabilities. Contribute to the evaluation and selection of software product standards.

**Minimum Requirements**:


Requires a bachelor’s or foreign equivalent degree in information systems, computer science or a related field and 7 years of experience in the position offered or 7 years of experience performing delivery in SAP TPM (Trade Promotion Management) module in medium to complex solution architecture providing implementation and enhancement deliverables. Also requires 7 years of experience: performing delivery working with SAP TPM and SAP ERP modules in medium to complex solution architecture owning architecture for New Feature Implementation (Enhancements); performing delivery in SAP System Integrations and middleware for SAP TPM solutions modules in medium to complex solution architecture; performing delivery in Trade Promotion Management (TPM), Trade Promotion Optimization (TPO), Revenue Management (RM), BW Analytics/Reporting for Trade, and Pricing/Price optimization; and performing delivery in implementing SAP TPM, SAP CRM, SAP SD, SAP FSCM, as well as capabilities for Revenue Management or Pricing. In lieu of a bachelor’s degree in aforementioned fields and 7 years of experience as stated, employer will accept 2 additional years of experience. Requires 5 years of experience: performing ABAP programming for SAP ERP, SAP BW, SAP UDF/CAR, SAP CRM Claims, and UI5; and performing delivery in SAP BW modules in medium to complex solution architecture including Production Support and New Feature Implementation (Enhancements). Requires 2 years of experience performing delivery in SAP TPM (Trade Promotion Management) module in medium to complex solution architecture; providing Production Support with ability to debug and code to fix issues; and performing delivery working with BW and HANA (or BW on HANA ) modules in medium to complex solution architecture for New Feature Implementation (Enhancements). Requires 1 year of experience performing delivery in TPM – CBP End-to-End New Implementation with Solution Architecture ownership all the way from Analysis through Go-Live. Employee reports to office in Roswell, GA, but may telecommute from anywhere in the U.S. Experience may be, but need not be, acquired concurrently.


Total rewards at Kimberly-Clark includes pay and a full package of benefits that can be tailored to individual needs. The anticipated pay range for this job has a range of $159,175 to $168,519 per year, in addition to bonus potential. Individual pay levels will be based on multiple factors including, but are not limited to, location, role, skill set, and level of experience.”


#Li-dni

title: Digital Solutions Systems Architect (Minneapolis OR Remote)
description:
At Mozarc Medical, our vision is to reimagine the future of holistic kidney health technology. Established in 2023 out of equal investments from DaVita, a leading provider of kidney care services, and Medtronic, one of the world’s largest medical device companies, Mozarc Medical offers an exciting and unique start-up experience backed by the support of two long-time industry and market leaders.
  
Driven by our mission and values, we put our patients at the center of all we do. Our employees play a key role in developing technology solutions that enrich patients’ lives and create meaningful progress in the treatment of kidney disease. Find your purpose and passion at Mozarc Medical.
  
**Position Title:** Digital Solutions Systems Architect
  
  

Day In The Life
  
A digital solutions systems architect is a key individual contributor of the digital product development team. The role is focused on uncovering stakeholder needs and developing connectivity blueprints that align with business strategy. You will develop an overall north star technical vision for a medical device connectivity ecosystem and bring in a “big-picture” perspective to adaptation of new ideas.
  
Responsibilities
  
* Work with external stakeholders, subject matter experts, and product managers to develop a product roadmap of solution capabilities with respect to the priority of business needs and development timeline.
* Conceptualize long term, sustainable, digitals solutions leveraging the latest security best practices and emerging technology.
* Define, describe, diagram, and document current, transitional and target state (north star) of Digital Technology architecture roadmaps.
* Understand, interpret and apply the unique implications of developing a connectivity solution for a regulated, active medical device ecosystem.
* Design, develop, and maintain scalable and reliable systems and infrastructure that meet the needs of our products and business requirements.
* Perform functional analysis, timeline analysis, detail trade studies, architectural allocation, and interface definition studies to translate stakeholder needs into system requirements.
* Provide technical leadership and mentoring of engineering teams, working closely with other architects and business leaders to define, design, and implement new platform features and services.
* Research, evaluate, and prototype new technologies to realize our connectivity vision and deliver the highest satisfaction to patients and clinicians.


Must Have
  
* Bachelor’s degree with 10 years of work experience in designing and implementing digital solutions/IT/product software or advanced degree with 8 years of similar work experience.


Nice To Have
  
* Minimum 5 years works experience as a Program Lead, Product Owner, or Lead Developer.
* Excellent communication skills with the ability to translate technical ideas to business stakeholders and facilitate architecture discussions.
* Significant experience in designing, building, and maintaining scalable and reliable platforms using cloud-native technologies (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP).
* Experience with IoT architecture and methodologies.
* Possesses a strong understanding of functional and customer requirements and be capable of effectively teaching and mentoring others on how to develop, write, and manage requirements.
* Medical device IoT connectivity experience.
* Experience in a fast-paced growth focused organization.
* Experience with electronic medical records (HIPAA managed data)
* Familiarity working in an iterative development model with a focus on continuous delivery.
* Experience with infrastructure as code, configuration management, and automation tools.
* Delivery of complete end to end IoT solutions for regulated products.
* Knowledge of regulatory (FDA, EU) requirements and frameworks applicable to medical products.
* Awareness of emerging and existing legislation with security implications (e.g., DiGA, GDPR, CCPA).
* Proficiency using UML/SysML, and experience with Model Based Engineering approaches, methods, and techniques, as well as tools such as Enterprise Architect.
* Familiar with hospital information systems such as EMR or PDMS.
* Ability To Travel
* Ability to travel 25%, including internationally.


Why Work with Us?
  
Working here is highly rewarding – we have the privilege of helping kidney patients experience greater freedom, improved outcomes and a renewed passion for life.
  
It’s essential our team members feel valued, supported and empowered too. That’s why we provide a comprehensive total rewards package and opportunities to grow, develop and give back to the communities where we live and work – helping you reach your potential and enjoy a career full of life-changing possibilities.
  
  

Physical Job Requirements
  
The physical demands described within the Responsibilities section of this job description are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. For Office Roles: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to be independently mobile. The employee is also required to interact with a computer, and communicate with peers and co-workers. Contact your manager or local HR to understand the Work Conditions and Physical requirements that may be specific to each role. (ADA-United States of America)
  
  

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.
  
  

Is this the position you were waiting for? Apply here!

title: Mainframe Solution Architect
description:
At Ensono, our **Purpose is to be a relentless ally, disrupting the status quo and unleashing our clients to** ***Do Great Things!*** We enable our clients to achieve key business outcomes that reshape how our world runs. As an expert technology adviser and managed service provider with cross-platform certifications, Ensono empowers our clients to keep up with continuous change and embrace innovation.



We can ***Do Great Things*** because we have great Associates. The Ensono Core Values unify our diverse talents and are woven into how we do business. These five traits are the key to achieving our purpose.


*Honesty, Reliability, Collaboration, Curiosity, Passion*


**What You Will Do:**



Mainframe Solution Architect leverages knowledge of IBM mainframe technology to help document, shape, and direct the technology roadmap for Ensono and for our clients. Works directly with senior executives and leadership to identify and address technology gaps, strategic goals, and business imperatives impacted by infrastructure technologies. Suggests new technologies or new approaches to achieve business goals. Develops methodologies to integrate technology innovation with existing governance and enterprise architecture processes. Provides fully costed solution architecture to meet client and prospective client requests. Maintains and updates documentation related to organization-wide IT activities and technology roadmaps. Communicate progress and direction through formal presentations, collaborative meetings, and content publishing to mixed audiences.



The Solution Architect would also support new business opportunities including pre-sales support, architecture, contracting, and design support for that client:


* Leads implementation of Ensono solutions and/or manages complex change that significantly impacts an existing solution.
* Ensures individualized solution incorporates clients’ and Ensono’s overall business strategy and technical vision.
* Technical lead in all solution communications with client and overseeing its progress throughout the implementation phase.


**Key Areas of Focus for this Role**


* Moderate complexity assignments – owner (1 or >)
* Low complexity assignments – owner (1 or >)
* Regularly lead self and others and/or established as Product SME and/or established as specialist.
* Understands how the whole picture aligns to overall Ensono strategy.
* Responsible for the creation and maintenance of reference architecture for Ensono infrastructure solutions
* Responsible for the infrastructure architecture of one or more client environments and will become a subject matter expert for the entire environment within the datacenter.
* Responsible for working with the client to obtain the solution requirements for the infrastructure.
* Responsible for written design of the infrastructure solution that meets or exceeds the requirements utilizing a reference architecture.
* Responsible for being the technical subject matter expert for the implementation and ensuring the implementation adheres to the proposed design.
* Responsible for presenting cost estimates for the mainframe solution implementation process and ongoing production support of the solution
* Engages in project communications with the client using a consultative approach, anticipates obstacles, and recommends solution options to mitigate.
* Ensures infrastructure solution design fulfills functional and technical requirements and can consistently meet progress against service level agreements (SLAs.)
* Accountable for the accuracy, process, integrity, quality, and stewardship of client mainframe infrastructure solutions.
* Participates in the development of RFP responses and presentations.


**What You Will Need:**


* Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related field or equivalent experience
* Typically requires a minimum of 8-10 years of related experience.
* Previous background with IBM mainframes, including previous experience as a systems programmer supporting complex mainframe environments.
* Foundational: ITILv3, ITSM a plus
* Mainframe: IBM
* Storage Platforms (EMC, IBM, Hitachi, Oracle)

  


**Why** **Ensono****?**



Ensono is a place we unleash Associates to ***Do Great Things*** – for our clients and for your career. This could mean achieving a professional goal, collaborating with your team on an innovative idea, learning a new skill, reaching a wellness milestone, or engaging in your community through volunteer programs. Whatever it means to you, we want Ensono to be the place where you can do great things.


* We value flexibility and work-life balance. Positions that are not required to be onsite to support a client may offer the ability to work remotely or hybrid at an Ensono office location.
* Unlimited Paid Day Off (PDO) Plan
* Two robust health plan options through Blue Cross Blue Shield
* 401(k) with a generous company match
* Eligibility for dental, vision, short and long-term disability, life and AD&D coverage, and flexible spending accounts
* Depending on location, ability to take advantage of fitness centers
* Wellness program
* Flexible work schedule


Ensono is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. We are committed to providing equal employment to our Associates and building a diverse and inclusive workforce. All qualified applicants will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, or other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law.



Pay transparency nondiscrimination statement/posting OFCCP’s pay transparency policy can be found on OFCCP’s website.



If you need accommodation at any point during the application or interview process, please let your recruiter know or email USTalentAcquisition@ensono.com.

title: Salesforce Enterprise Architect (Vlocity)
description:
**Position Overview**

The Information Technology Department is currently seeking a Salesforce Architect. The successful candidate will spearhead our efforts to adapt and utilize Salesforce, providing support to our business operations. This role involves responsibility for a broad range of critical applications built on the Salesforce platform. The Salesforce Architect will also oversee the performance and operation of the Salesforce Development team, providing management, leadership, and mentorship.

**Job Description**

* Provide leadership in the overall Salesforce architecture, application design and development of the system.
* Possess a deep understanding of Salesforce products, as well as the customization and development possibilities.
* Has to architect solutions on Salesforce that are secure, scalable, and meet the business requirements
* Ensuring that the solution, and all customizations to the platform meet best practices
* Ensure architectural integrity and consistency across the entire product.
* Knowledgeable on all Salesforce offerings, sales cloud, service cloud, force.com, etc.
* Design documentation and best practice methodologies
* Create & deliver, in a timely and accurate fashion, CRMs and workflow solutions using Salesforce/Apex, Force, Visualforce, Vlocity and J2EE technologies.
* Has deep understanding of Salesforce Health Cloud and VLocity Healthcare Industry
* Working knowledge of Salesforce integration using MuleSoft
* Overseeing the delivery of the architect solution
* Organize the process for successful project delivery to the end users.
* Plan and manage the application deployment using Azure CD/CI pipeline.
* Review Salesforce capabilities, workflow, and scheduling limitations to determine if requested program or program change is possible within Salesforce.
* Study existing information processing systems to evaluate effectiveness and develops new systems to improve production or workflow as required.
* Oversee programming development and testing of interfaces according to the specifications.
* Help with on-going application maintenance.
* Mentor team members to use best practice and new technology needs.

**Minimum Qualifications**

* 10+ years of related professional experience.
* Experience in full cycle programming.
* College or University degree in Computer Science or a related discipline.
* Possess and demonstrate strong written and oral communication skills.

**Professional Competencies**

* Operational and technical experience with development tools include but not limited to Salesforce/Apex, Force, Visualforce, Vlocity and J2EE technologies; Web Services, REST API, SOSL and SOQL, Salesforce. Com's Web Services and APIs, and the Salesforce Security model
* Process Analysis, Workflows, Page Layouts, Roles, Profiles, Reports & Dashboards
* Architecting and building solutions within the Salesforce Portal
* Integrating SFDC using Web Methods, Web services, SSO, etc.
* Strong understanding of Microsoft DevOps framework; Content Versioning; Agile methodology.
* Strong experience with Database design, including Microsoft SQL Server database platform (latest version) with a focus on T-SQL
* Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Analytical ability to evaluate and construct accurate and efficient programming solution to business problems.
* Working experience with Marketing and Customer Service in Health Care
* Familiarity with ServiceNow.

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Health insurance

Experience level:

* 5 years

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

* professional: 10 years (Preferred)
